Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dubvalue
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this Quality Inn just before Hurricane Isaac and, though the hotel manager, Stephanie O'Rourke, is no relation the staff here took care of me like I was family. The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from the French quarter in one direction and the best of the Garden District in the other. Museums are also within easy reach. Though undergoing repair when I was staying there the street car is just outside the hotel. Wifi was free and good.

Reviews.Title: “Maison St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: Mort G
Reviews.Content: Room was kind of run down but clean. If you get a king room it includes a refrigerator and microwave. Free wi-fi, good speed,flat screen TV but no HDMI input so I couldn't connect my laptop to stream movies from Netflix. Bed was fairly firm and comfortable, room was quiet in regards to traffic or outside noise other than your neighbors; we had people in the rooms on either side of us and never heard anything through the walls either. Room phone was out as well as Showtime during our 5 day stay despite the fact that maintenance told us that they had reported it to the phone and cable companies. Nicely landscaped grounds with scattered shaded seating areas, nice pool area. Breakfast was cheese omelet, turkey sausage, Belgian waffle, pastries, cereal, yogurt, some fruit, drinks, coffee from 6:30-9:00 weekdays, 7-10 weekends. Adding some salsa or hot sauce would be nice. Area is not the best but plenty safe to walk around during the day. Emerald has a restaurant across the street, a 24 hr bar/grill on the next corner, a few other restaurants within two blocks, an Office Depot on the next block and streetcar stops on the block. Streetcar line has undergoing repairs while we were there but the City added bus routes to take its place. Staff was very friendly and helpful although I wouldn't ask for restaurants recommendations; as a former resident and frequent visitor to New Orleans what I overheard as suggestions weren't where I would go, stick to nomenu.com for eateriies. Although the area isn't the best part of St. Charles Ave. the security was very good. They have a 24 hr guard, large metal gates that they close a night to turn the area into a secured compound and their parking lot next to the hotel (self park, $17 plus tax per nite) is also well fenced and closed and monitored at night. Should you need your car at night security will let you in to get it. Our party had to leave early due to Hurricane Isaac headed for New Orleans; management was very understanding and waived their cancellation rule. We all enjoyed our stay there and hated to leave early, especially since we had a fantastic rate and were facing several days of power outages across the lake. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lakelady45MM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2012 for Jazz Fest. Room was clean and comfy. Breakfast was good. Trolly stop right outside the door. Emeril's Demonico is right across the street as well. Would definately stay again! I felt it was a great value, loved the feel of the place and the pool was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: Magdalena C
Reviews.Content: Never again would we stay at this location, when we opened the room door the smell of mold and mildew almost made us leave immediately. The musty stink never went away even after we left the room door open to get fresh air. The bathroom was also filthy. The toilet was poorly cleaned, it had black stains and pubic hairs! The area around the tub drain was black and green and the tub wall was yellow, we were afraid to shower. We could not fall asleep because the room air was thick with must. We had to leave the room door open all night, which is not the safest thing to do in that area. The lock didn't work anyway. Pictures do not represent the condition of the rooms. Thankfully we only had to stay overnight. They charge you $17 for parking across the street. The car alarms went off all night. We could have park for free in the street for the amount of security the lot provided.The gate was never locked. We should have slept in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we found this great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun09
Reviews.Content: The location on St Charles St was great, the price very reasonable, the breakfast well above average (loved the waffle iron with a fleur-de-lis imprint!). The room was spacious and clean. There are several buildings with shady courtyards connecting them, so the outside was nice. Came here after a stay in a Ramada Inn in Biloxi and the Maison St Charles seemed like a luxury hotel by comparison. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again if we ever return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Unusual Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewR34
Reviews.Content: This was a real surprise. The hotel is a little hard to find as the front doesn't look like what you expect and the signage is minimal. It's an interesting property as it's made from reclaimed buildings originally built in the 1840s. The room was clean and nice (not amazing, but we were happy). The pool was a great refresher at the end of two hot 105-degree Fahrenheit days. The hotel was a 20 to 30 minute walk from the French Quarter, which was fine with us. The rate was very competitive. Overall, we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Prison Lockdown”
Reviews.Author: Blake A
Reviews.Content: It was a festival weekend in New Orleans and all the downtown hotels were booked so we got a room here. We arrived about 1:30 and were curtly told to come back after 3. We came back at 5:30 and were left standing in the lobby for over 30 min while they "checked to see if our room was ready". The room was OK, nothing special. The outside courtyards were nice to sit with a drink and read a book (while my wife took a nap). But once the sun went down, it was like a prison lockdown - the lobby doors were locked, the side gates were locked and a security guard was on patrol. We had an early flight out in the morning and I had to wake the security guard up to let us out (he was asleep in a chair by the pool). I thought that $17 a night to park my car myself in an empty lot across the street was a bit much. Considering we paid approx. the same or less for much nicer hotels downtown, I would only use this as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint gem”
Reviews.Author: Poissonoeuf
Reviews.Content: If you set your expectations for a mid-range hotel, you'll be pleasantly surprised. We were able to secure a two suite room for a surprisingly reasonable price (minus the per night taxes, that is). The room must have just been recently refurbished since the carpeting smelled new, walls were nicely painted, all the furnishings seemed in decent shape, and the beds were comfortable. The only problem we had was with the noise and draftiness of the rooms - but that may have been because of the age and location of the building (we were above the reception area). The location of the hotel is every bit as good as everyone writes. We were easily able to get to both the French Quarter and the Garden District either on foot or by bus (trolley was still being repaired). And although the area can get a little dicey at night, the hotel in on a main thoroughfare so just use common sense and stay away from questionable places/spaces.. Breakfast was nothing out of the ordinary. One additional note....If you book using the AAA rate, make sure to get the "free parking" perk in writing! Between the front desk and the reservation clerk, I got very different answers after booking the room. I made sure to call the hotel back and make them put it in writing on my reservation that free parking was included in my hotel rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days after a cruise. Very pleased!! I was told by a friend to stay here and was so glad we did. This place is right where you need to be to visit anything in New Orleans. The street car wasn't working because they are getting it ready for the Super Bowl but the buses run near the hotel. Taxi service to the airport from this hotel was $33 for 2 people, seems like a lot but it is 16 miles. The staff at this hotel is awesome. Very clean room. This hotel has different buildings with rooms surrounding courtyards. Also, free breakfast that was better than a normal continental. The front desk staff was always ready to help with our luggage, directions, transportation needs. Our group booked 4 rooms. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel we've discovered, Maison St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: LifeIn
Reviews.Content: Having been to NOLA many times, and having a few favorite places to stay in the Quarter, we decided to try a place out near the Garden District. We loved this hotel! The hotel is on Saint Charles St., with a street car stop right out front, is very convenient. The Magazine St. area was not too far away for a walk or a quick bike ride. A great pub over there is The Bulldog Pub, a must visit for beer enthusiasts! The accomodations were very clean and comfortable, the expansive grounds secure. Our room was done in a festive motif a little reminisint of Mardi Gras, but not gaudy (see picture with purple wall). You knew you were in New Orleans! Originally they gave us a room across from the elevator. However, we asked to me moved to an end room. Our room was instead across from stairs and a balcony overlooking the pool, much better and quiet! The hotel is five, old original buildings covering an entire city block. All buildings and rooms were preserved and renovated into a very quiet, quaint and charming hotel. They offer a full complimentary breakfast which is certainly good enough to get you started for your day in NOLA! Hot and cold offerings, fresh fruits, juices, cereals hot and cold, yogurts, bagels, waffles, pastries, scrambled or hard boiled eggs, sausage and some pretty good coffee. All served in a very spacious multi-room breakfast building adjacent to the pool with indoor and outdoor seating. There is a pool and a hot tub tht never seemed to be too crowded. So during our down time, it was easy to relax and enjoy this ammenity on Tuesday. It too was well kept and clean. I saw the pool guys out taking care of it each morning. The staff were friendly and accomodating and the price was right. There was a very large parking lot next door which they charge $17 a night. Very good for us as we left our car parked for the 3 nights and used our bicycles to get around. Having been to New Orleans more times than I can count, never for business and always for pleasure, I can say to you that we will keep this one high on the list of places to stay If you haven't been to NOLA or only a few times, there are so many other great areas of this city worth exploring besides the Quarter, so its really not hard to broaden your enjoyment. Magazine St., the Garden District, Frenchmen St. are new favorites on our must-visit list while in town. The Maison St. Charles sits in a location that makes doing that even easier. We did bring our bicycles to explore the Garden District, ride into the French Quarter and to get back and forth. This worked out great as we left the car in the hotel parking lot and biked our way around. The hotel is about a mile off Canal St. and was certainly easy to get over to via bike. There are so many bikers in the city that we felt comfortable with the traffic. The city has bike lanes almost everywhere for ease of use. Even at night, we stayed on the main thoroughfare and made it safely back to the hotel quite quickly. It is also nice that this hotel is in the Choice Hotels system, so we received points for staying here, plus they allow small dogs. We plan to be back to this hotel in the future when we visit this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: daninstlouis
Reviews.Content: WOW I am in town with my Church Group. We have 5 rooms and what a pleasant surprise we had when we got here. Beautiful courtyards in front of our rooms. Fountains and beautiful plants add to the experience. The staff is awesome! Very friendly and helpful. I like it so much we will be back in a week for a family trip. Comfortable rooms. Nice to have a fridge and a microwave in the room. Breakfast is included and tasty. I can not say enough about the staff. Worked with me and the teenagers I have with me. Ralph is very good to work with. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't be fooled by the photos!”
Reviews.Author: Whitney M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2012 while in New Orleans for the Men's Basketball final championship game. I was extremely pleased with the location of this hotel, as it was within walking distance to the arena, there were several late night pubs and eateries within walking distance, we even walked once to Bourbon Street although it was a decent trek. But the hotel is located right at one of the trolley stops, which can get you almost anywhere you need to go. I was really excited about the charming appearance of the hotel in the photos, but the hotel itself is much more outdated than it appears in the photos. Not to mention that at least while we were there, they were doing renovations and had microwaves and everything else outside all of the doors. I'm not sure if this is completed by now. It served its purpose, and we were able to bring our 2 puppies with us after paying a pet deposit, which I assume wouldn't be the case with a lot of the hotels in the area. And I say this while realizing that prices probably were elevated due to the events in the area, but I have stayed in much nicer for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GateFreak417
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for a conference and stayed a week at Maison St. Charles. It's far enough away from the French Quarter to escape the crowds, but you can readily get back down into the action by catching the streetcar in front of the hotel. It takes about an hour by multiple streetcars to reach the Convention Center, but it was really worth it to stay in such a quiet location. The hotel staff was great and the rooms, although small, are a great bargain. I'll definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Old and small”
Reviews.Author: 2cowboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on business. The room was very small. Did not even have a chair. The hotel is a historic structure, but has a musty smell. The hotel is close to many restaurants and the street car line.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: boykinleigh
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this lovely hotel! The staff is excellent, the rooms are clean and charming, the courtyard is beautiful, and the rates are extremely reasonable. I had such a positive experience at this hotel that I am booking a large number of rooms for the guests of my upcoming wedding. I would highly recommend this delightful hotel to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel with eclectic New Orleans charm!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: erza2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and has a well tended, peaceful courtyard where we could unwind after a day of sightseeing. They served a nice breakfast and we found the staff to be knowledgeable and helpful. The room was rather small, but clean, and the price was an extremely good value. There were several good restaurants and shops within walking distance, and the trolley stop was directly in front of the hotel. We found the laundry facilities on premises to be conveniently located and user friendly. This was our second stay at this hotel and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: 31Cents
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July and was pleased with this hotel and the deal through Living Social. It was clean and conveniently located. The air conditioning was great, The staff was friendly, helpful, and the complimentary breakfast was adequate. The hotel has lovely courtyards. The elevator was very unpleasant as it was hot, smelly, and had no air circulating. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Ash70460
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during Mardi Gras and just came across the pictures of the filth we stayed in which prompted me to write this review several months later. Hotel room was filthy, including mold growing in the shower and clearly was barely cleaned by the housekeeping staff. Housekeeping staff was very friendly, just not very thorough. This alone would have prompted a 2-3 star rating; however, the front desk attendants were extremely rude. One morning we hurried out of room to get out of the cleaning staff's way and thought we would just use the restroom in the lobby (which is a hike from the room we were in) on our way out of the hotel. We were rudely told that hotel guests were not allowed to use the hotel lobby restroom as it was reserved for non-guests that paid $10 for a wrist band to use the restroom. We were paying over $1000 to stay at this hotel for 4 nights and they refused to let us use the bathroom (with a newly potty trained child). We were told that by the time we got back to our room housekeeping would likely be done. Additionally our room rate was advertised to include breakfast in the morning. When we went to the lobby area for breakfast we were laughed at and told that breakfast isn't served during Mardi Gras. Icing on the cake was when we tried to leave the hotel, our car had been blocked in by 2 other cars of hotel employees. I understand that is was Mardi Gras weekend, but this was several hours after the parades had passed, and they took about an hour to locate the 2 employees to move their cars. Good thing we didn't have a flight to catch! We live only 45 miles away, but always stay in a hotel for Mardi Gras. We reserved our rooms too late and this was the only hotel on St. Charles with any availability...I understand why now. This hotel is just before the lower Garden District area, near I-10 and Lee Circle. Being locals, we knew that the area is elatively unsafe but we thought that it should be fine during Mardi Gras. Wrong. Someone was shot right next door at the Wendy's during Mardi Gras weekend...of course that is out of the hotel's control. Just thought it was important to mention to those not familiar with the area. All around a horrible experience. Don't let the cute pictures and cheap price lure you into this dump!

Reviews.Title: “So SO”
Reviews.Author: scooter65
Reviews.Content: When you first get there it looks very nice, then you back to where the rooms are. The grounds are nice looking but most areas need to cleaned, wash down swept up just cleaned up. The rooms to look at were fine, but the first had a leaking pipe. They move us to another room with the celling falling down no cold water broken light covers and few other thing. The breakfast was not good...The people working there were very nice and try to help.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Britta C
Reviews.Content: We bought a deal on Living Social, which was very good. But it didn't look quite as good as the website, and the pool was small and too warm for comfort. Our friends had a room with a defective shower, so the kind staff upgraded them to a much bigger room which ultimately showed good service. Breakfast was pretty good, but in the future I would rather stay closer to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “All booked!?”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I loved our stay at Maison. Everything and everyone was superb! I am returning with my daughters father this fall and we plan to marry while there after 23 yrs together! I was really hoping to stay at Maison again but alas, no rooms left. I have gone on and on to him about the great breakfast you provide, how nice and clean the rooms were, how great the staff was to us, and how pretty the hotel and grounds were. I have stayed at other hotels in N.O. but can't seem to commit to another now. UGHHHH. Maybe someone will cancel but I'm afraid to wait, seems like everything is booking up fast. I will miss you :(

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: kmf2279
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly and so willing to help. I especially liked Juliet at breakfast every morning. She was so sweet and helpful, also hilarious. The girl who checked us in was also very friendly and patient. I was so surprised that everything that was offered in the LivingSocial deal was given without hesitation. It was so well worth it, and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Maison St. Charles!”
Reviews.Author: lisaleesalisa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice- August of 2011 and August of 2012. Loved the hotel/location in 2011 so much that when I realized I would be making a return visit, there was no doubt of where we would be staying at. The hotel is several buildings with courtyards. The rooms each time were nice and clean with PERFECT AC because Nawlins in August is like walking around in a wet electric blanket- the rooms were always inviting to return to. For the price and location, you can't beat it. Add the fact you walk out the front door to the streetcar line, BONUS! You don't have to drive/park and can get pretty much anywhere you want to go. I don't know the direction, but if you get on the car that goes left from the hotel, it'll take you to the French Quarter and dump you right out at Bourbon Street. To the right, you'll pass beautiful homes, Loyola and Tulane- that's nice to ride it down then back up. I know I will stay here every time I visit the city because it's a great deal, fab location and just a really neat little place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Renee A
Reviews.Content: I spoke with a Tasha who reserved my room with the nastiest attitude known to mankind. When I called back to ask a question I was told that my reservation did not exist and they were sold out of rooms. The other couples that was traveling with us had already booked their rooms and we were left out. HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Repeat Guest...and looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: Michele E
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after our second stay at the Maison St. Charles. We were there for three days in November for the Po-Boy Fest and stayed on the second floor in one of the suites, which we found to be charming and very comfortable. This time we stayed for a week in one of the rooms around the courtyard. The bed was VERY comfortable...The breakfast area is really nice with a satisfying array of breakfast items. Every morning we took our breakfast in the lovely courtyard (complete with a fountain) just outside our room. The location is convenient and parking is less expensive than other hotels in the CBD and French Quarter. As others have mentioned, the streetcar is very handy as it stops right in front of the hotel. Plus, we just love the property, which is handsomely landscaped. For the price, it is absolutely our choice for lodging in NOLA. Those who have grumbled about the cost should be informed that ALL the hotels in New Orleans are more costly during the high season and during any major festivals. Lastly, we found the housekeeping staff and front desk folks to be very friendly and helpful. We visit New Orleans a couple of times each year and will be staying here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcfrankl
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Maison St Charles for the last 3 years when we travel to New Orleans. It is reasonably priced, very clean and friendly staff, we love staying here. To say nothing of the location-perfect! I usually do not write a review, but had to now. My husband left his new expensive watch on the night stand when we checked out. Gloria, the lady that cleaned our room found it and the manager had it in hand when we called to report we left it. They were great and mailed it out the next day. We can not say enough about this hotel and the personnel that work here. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at the Maison St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: Jillybean F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel without knowing a lot about the hotel, the area, or New Orleans as it was our first visit to New Orleans. I am very pleased with my 'choice' as this hotel was excellent. It has been undergoing some refurbishment and the rooms are fresh and colourful. The rooms are large, and our room had a safe, although at the time, some didn't due to the ongoing refurbishment. All rooms had large flat screen TV's. The Streetcar stops right outside the door so transport is easy. Breakfast was quite adequate with cerals, breads, waffles, fruit, eggs coffee and tea, all included in the tariff. All the staff were friendly and welcoming and that always makes a difference as a guest. There are many restaurants and fast food establishments within walking distance of the hotel. We were there during the Jazz/Blues Festival in early April 2012 and it was absolutely chaotic in French Quarter so it was nice to jump the streetcar and come home to a little bit of piece and quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans, it's clean, it's happy and it's great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CurlyGirl82
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, good service and a reasonable price for the area. We stayed four nights--the room was very clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy, but it served its purpose as we were out and about most of the day. The location was perfect for what we needed--the streetcar stops right outside the hotel and it was great for getting around town. You do have to pay for parking, and if you come back in too late at night, the gate is locked, but the security staff was always quick to unlock and let us in. It seemed to be a good place for families, as we saw a number of kids enjoying the pool area. The courtyards are nice and the hotel overall has a New Orleans charm that you wouldn't expect at a chain location. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: scubamargie
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our room which featured heavy velvet curtains and period furniture, even though we had to hike 4 large pieces of luggage to the second floor (no elevator). Our daughter and son-in-law stayed in a different building where the toilet didn't work and the room decore was prostitute-worthy. We just stayed one night so the toilet never did get fixed. Breakfast waffles were great. We got a deal on this hotel, but I certainly wouldn't pay the regular rate. Parking is scarce so we had to park on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: ilovejack02
Reviews.Content: There are lot of positive things to say about this lil inn. Good location , really friendly, helpful front desk staff and easy parking . The grounds were lovely , pretty pool, breakfast area was clean , food decent and the surroundings were relaxing. Bed was comfortable , linens were nice. My main issue was room was fairly clean ,but by no means perfect. There was a HOLE in the tile at the shower head , there was smudges on walls in bathroom, smashed mosquito or two and make up on light switches and bath room door. Tile grout could use a clean up too . Nothing that was too difficult , just a little elbow grease was needed. Room was dust free . For a little over 200.00 for the night including tax, I would have hoped better than pretty clean. I emailed corporate about two weeks after with issues and offer of pictures and heard nothing back, hopefully at least someone read it and issues were taken care of .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mythernal
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything that we needed. Clean, convenient (trolley stop directly across the street) with a smallish pool that the kids loved. A decent breakfast buffet was included. Parking was a bit of an issue. I got a deal on the room from Travelzoo and it was an excellent value for the price! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We was very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: KWOMAC
Reviews.Content: First of all they need to change those pictures on line......its seem like the whole hotel is beautiful ...the room was smelling like smoke n we had a non smoking room..n the only thing that is nice is the lobby..that how they get u there..n the rooms in front is so bad they need to n tore down......I wouldn't book my DOG to stay there..

Reviews.Title: “WOW! GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: SMcGowan36
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Cousin, and myself chose to stay here on a 1-night stay while waiting to transfer to another hotel for a wrk conference. You could say we were Lucky to stay at the Maison St Charles! As everyone has stated before me, it sits directly on St. Charles avenue, opposite the French Quarter. The Street car does stop right out front and CAN be busy, but we didn't find this to be a problem on a weeknight after the Jazz Fest had concluded. **Tip: Save yourself the time and purchase a Full-Day, or 3-Day pass DIRECTLY from on the Streetcar(correct change only)** We loved staying on that quiet part of St Charles, it put us mere feet from a few of the finer restraunts around that part of New Orleans. (Emeril's, Zea, Mia's Balcony) It had a quaint, multi-building set-up, that does make you feel far from the noise of the Quarter. Room was REALLY clean, simple, but CLEAN! I can't forget to mention how AWESOME the beds slept... which directly ties into why we didn't get to make their brunch everyone talks about... did I mention how difficult it was to tear ourselves from those beds? Price could be better, but don't think we over-paid at all. We would stay here again in a HEARTBEAT!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: John_G525
Reviews.Content: We had a suite room, which was situated inside the complex around a pleasant courtyard. The room was rather shabby, even though a friend who had stayed at the hotel the previous year told us when she saw the room that in her opinion it was one of their refurbished rooms. One of the first things I did was to climb up on the fridge in order to secure the curtains properly to the curtain track. I also had to dispose of a cockroach climbing up the wall. However the room was spacious and the air-con was more than adequate. The room was were quiet, despite the hotel being full for Jazz Fest, until a dumster came along at about 4am and noisily emptied the waste bins in and around the hotel, which happened daily. Breakfasts were good, all staff were helpful and friendly, and the location was good with the street cars stopping just outside the hotel. In the afternoons you could sit out in the shady courtyards or around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation close to the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: lovethebruce
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal & checked out the location online. Maison St. Charles is located in the Garden District and on the streetcar line, a ten minute ride to the heart of downtown & the french quarter. We were upgraded from a room to a suite, and it was gorgeous, complete with high ceilings, fireplace & chandeliers in the oldest building which dates back the the early 1800's. As it was our first trip to New Orleans, we didn't take advantage of all the amenities, but breakfast was included and we did spend some time in the hot tub. The staff were very friendly and courteous and made our stay there wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: essbee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated on St Charles Avenue close to eating and drinking places (try the Circle Bar) and convenient for the street car which travels down St Charles Avenue. The hotel itself has a lovely lobby and decorated in a period French style. The rooms are at the back of the hotel and overlook some pretty gardens and fountains. Our room had a large bed and was very spacious. It has a safe and coffee making facilities. There were plenty of towels and the room was very clean. I would describe it as "shabby chic". The breakfast was poor and you had to use plastic plates and cutlery. There wasn't a lot of choice and what was available each day was inconsistent. Coffee was good. However, it was lovely to sit out in the courtyard to eat breakfast. Reception staff could have been friendlier but the security staff who patrolled the grounds in the evening were very chatty. Didn't try the restaurant or the pool. Overall pleasant experience. You must try the Commander's Palace for lunch one day. Beautiful old building, amazing food, friendly staff AND 25C COCKTAILS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Jazzfest”
Reviews.Author: Kimma1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel three months in advance for Jazzfest, thinking that would be plenty of time to find a nice room. Well, this was a last resort situation as there were no rooms to be had and beggars could not be choosy. We found this room through American Express, really wanting to use our travel rewards -- this was all we could come up with. Expecting the worst, were pleasantly surprised by the location, we walked and trolleyed to the French Quarter. Also, we had easy access to our car which was great for Jazzfest. It only took us ten minutes to get to the Fairgrounds and the route was a breeze. Now, the hotel pool was a little dirty but nothing we could not handle. The room was tiny with no closet or wardrobe to hang our clothing but we managed (only in town for three nights). I would recommend it if you are not hanging out at the hotel a lot. On the upside, the breakfast buffet was perfect by the courtyard -- great coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything and reasonably priced!!”
Reviews.Author: SallyShu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for the Final Four Basketball tourney from March 30th until April 4th. When we arrived we were a little concerned until we walked through the archway and arrived in back to a lovely landscaped and gardened retreat. The bldgs are older (on the national registry) But we had a totally redone room that was quite comfortable. The street car stops right infront of the hotel and you can either walk or ride the street car to almost all of the main attractions in New Orleans...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but clean, comfortable, and a good value”
Reviews.Author: Skeptic2241
Reviews.Content: Not exactly in the heart of things, but surprisingly convenient. This hotel is right on St. Charles Avenue just a couple of blocks southwest of the Hwy 90 overpass. The streetcar stops right in front and will take you to Canal Street (the edge of hte French Quarter) in about 15-20 minutes. The convention center is about a 15 minute walk or a 5 minuite cab ride. The rooms are generously sized and clean, although some of the furnishings are a bit worn. My room had a refrigerator and microwave. Rates are quite reasonable and include a better than average continental breakfast and Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Copperdesk63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the 2nd weekend of JazzFest for over 10 years and generally love staying here because the location works for us and the staff is great. Nothing has changed on those two points but in other areas the hotel needs work. First I enter my room with an early check in which was great. As I am laying my bags down ready to head to the Fest I see a nice waterbug on the floor near the safe. I am not freaked out it and at least it was dead so shows they are doing spraying but not something you want to see in the first minute. They did move me to another room and comped me for the $17 parking cost that night so that was nice. Also the rooms need a little refurbishing with peeling wallpaper and some paint disappearing. For the prince, location and the very helpful and friendly staff it is the same as it ever was. But they need to do some work and I will definitely be looking around for new rooms next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, older property. Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Faygelah
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the garden district. Rooms are grouped into three courtyards with pools, fountains,and tables and chairs in the middle to encourage interaction, but also to provide quiet public spaces for guests. Rooms are clean and comfortable, but nothing special. Our rom included a refrigerator and a microwave as well as ample room. Â Service was a bit spotty; we asked for extra pillows which were promised, but never delivered. The tiny bathroom showed cigarette burns on the ledge of the bathtub and the plumbing is not the greatest, but overall it was a fine experience. Just next door is a daiquiri shop with dangerous adult slushees. We had bikes with us and enjoyed the leisurely 5 minute bike ride to the French quarter. The St Charles streetcar also runs directly in front of the hotel. Â

Reviews.Title: “OK ...but older. Need to keep an eye on the little things.”
Reviews.Author: ORLANDOTOURGUIDE
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the gardens district, this is not the place. It's close but no.... However you want a sweet little courtyard, it'll work. Breakfast is nice outside....but no fruit on one day and donuts were just laying in a pile in a box for a sweet snack. Not sure about that. Don't go for the pool - it's almost nonexistent. Don't go for the promise of wi-fi - that was almost non-existent as well. We received a refund on part of our stay for just this reason. This is ok, but I think I'd rather be at a better brand next time. I'd feel more like things were going to be well taken care of - all around.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Location”
Reviews.Author: MtAiryAve
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with historic feel surrounding a very pretty private courtyard with pool and hot tub. Located right on St Charles streetcar near the Garden District. Our room was a little cramped with so-so amenities but perfectly serviceable and clean. There is also no fitness center, although many people jog and walk down the streetcar line outside the front door. We parked on the street instead of paying $17/night and had no problem in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Lori1558
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with that New Orleans flavor but not in the French Quarter, this is a great place to stay. It is charming, with cobblestone driveways and nice courtyards in each of its sections. We had an issue with our key reader and the staff went out of their way to fix it quickly. Front office staff was friendly and helpful. The room was adequate as was their morning breakfast. If you have a car, parking is only $17 per night vice $30-35 near or in the Quarter. The Santa Fe Tapas restaurant next door serves excellent drinks and terrific tapas. However, they have quite a nightly clientele that shows up for happy hour and lingers outside and often stands in front of the hotel entrance. The St. Charles streetcar line stops right in front of the hotel. This was really convenient to go into town and back. Saves on cab fares which average about $10 for two with tip each way compared to $1.25 for the streetcar (or 40 cents for seniors). There is also a Wendy's and Popeye's right next door. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance, tho the hotel only has a few on their lobby list.

Reviews.Title: “best price I found”
Reviews.Author: Helen1950
Reviews.Content: We needed a last minute spot to stay in New Orleans and decided to stay at one of our choices we had not stayed at in a while. It was quiet, steps from the trolley, parking was $17 instead of $32 and you could get to your car easily. They also had a continental breakfast offered. I noticed that they also had washer and dryers on premises. Our room was available at 11 a.m. (it was a Wednesday) and they let us move right in--but if not you can park your car there early and sightsee and wait for check in. The trolley takes you straight to Canal Street on the edge of the French Quarter. You ride with the locals and get the feel of the town of New Orleans. You can now buy day passes on the trolley. Go to New Orleans and enjoy this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: clarkestes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. The streetcar that went to the French Quarter was right across the street ($4.00 a day fare allowed one to ride all of the streetcars for a day). This beats driving into town and finding a palce to park. Parking was available for an additional $17.00 per day. The hotel itself was a series of buildings surrounded by trees and flowers some of which were old refurbished Lousiana buildings. Our room on the top - 3rd floor - was quiet. Breakfast was good with hot entrees, yogurt, bagles, waffles, etc. This is a member of the Choice Hotels chain, but quite charming. Room prices can vary based on week or weekend days and what is going on in town. We looked at staying an extra day on a Friday for a festival, but rates went up about $100.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star but really a great find”
Reviews.Author: jane1121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super convenient to the streetcar stop. It maintains a good New Orleans vibe. Music plays through speakers around the property, courtyards have nice seating and landscaping (love the beads in the trees), a small but welcoming pool, breakfast was good with many options and nice seating areas. The breakfast building is historic and has a nice vibe, mattresses were comfy, The Wendy's beside the hotel was convenient for late night drinks or frosty treats! Will definitely stay here again. It is also family friendly being in the garden district but was not over run with children. The only thing I noticed was the elevators are old but we mostly used the stairs. It is only two stories.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: VikingLady74
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very convenient for us, both the most beautiful streets of the Garden District and French Quarter were easily accessible. The location on St. Charles is not really quiet, the lobby of the hotel is on a busy street, the rooms, however, are in the back part of the property, surrounded by trees and flower beds - all clean and very well kept. We also enjoyed the on-site restaurant that provided really nice Mexican food and a very friendly service. The breakfast was also good, we appreciated the option of sitting outside in the morning sun. Just a few street-car stops away (close to the Commanders Palace) there is a mini-mini-shopping mall, very cozy, with a European Style Cafe- very recommendable for an afternoon break. And, don't forget to stop by Sucre on Magazine Street (also Garden District) - a huuuuge choice of ice-cream, cakes and chocolate. We would love to come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rates, charming space (but still a chain hotel)”
Reviews.Author: FoodieOnAHarley
Reviews.Content: Love the location: On St. Charles, i.e. on the streetcar line, close to where the Lower Garden District ends and the Central Business District begins. OK, it's not as beautiful as the Upper Garden District, but if you like to walk, you can walk to the French Quarter, and there's no lack of charm in the surrounding neighborhood. (Try walking around on Magazine Street or Camp Street rather than St. Charles.) The layout is very pretty - several buildings clustered around various courtyards with flowers and trees in them. My guess is a few of the buildings are old and the rest were constructed to look old. My room was a normal-size hotel room (not the tiny rooms you find in genuine old buildings). It had all the features you'd expect from a normal mid-range chain hotel, and a kind of wacky decor with lots of purple. Staying midweek in March, my rate (AAA I think) was $98. You do pay to park - $17/night - and the parking lot is across a side street, not a long distance, but it's not in front of your door. The continental breakfast was totally ordinary - cereal, bagels, make-em-yourself waffles, and some weird little omelet-looking things you could microwave. Nothing special, but you wouldn't starve. There's at least one very charming funky little breakfast spot a couple blocks away (Blue Plate Cafe on Prytania Street) and I'd say that's a much better option if you have time and don't mind paying for breakfast rather than getting it free. My only quibble - and this probably won't bother most people: If you want the weirdness and funkiness and other-worldliness that is New Orleans - you won't find it here (well, other than the purple walls). It's a Quality Inn -- pretty and a bit unusual, but still, a Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: Justine S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and will continue to stay in this hotel for all of my trips to New Orleans. We are from Pennsylvania and moved to Louisiana for a short year and made several trips to New Orleans. If you are someone who does not wish to be in the "center" of drunk people in the quarter, I would highly recommend finding a hotel in the garden district. This area is much safer and BEAUTIFUL. If you enjoy walking, it is about a 15 minute walk to Bourbon/French Quarter but if you would rather not walk, the St. Charles streetcar is located on the same street as this hotel and has a stop right in front of the hotel, all you pay is $3.00 to ride all day and can ride up and down the garden district, up and down canal, and to the museum and city park. This hotel has real New Orleans charm and is very well kept. The only recommendation I would have is to ensure you request a top floor room, as all of the walkways in the hotel are brick and you can hear people rolling their suitcases very early in the morning if you stay on the bottom floor (we made that mistake once). The breakfast is fantastic!!! I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CastellariClan
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our room on a travel website recommended by the hotel and we were booked at a rate of $280 per night plus taxes which would've been around $300 total per night. We booked to stay Saturday March 31st- Tuesday April 3rd. We were traveling by car 10 hours from Tampa, Florida and had planned to stop half way Friday night but the drive was smooth and decided to come on into New Orleans. We called the hotel and reached a female clerk late evening that told us they did have a room available that we could check in an evening earlier. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 pm Friday March 30th, quite cheerful despite our long trip. The parking for check in is in a lot down a back alley behind the lobby and a courtyard. We enter through the back in the rain and there was a man behind the counter with a scowl on his face. He never greeted us. Finally my husband said, "How are you doing?", the man said "Busy!", in an angry tone and looked down. My husband tried to make small talk to lighten him up to no avail. He was very abrupt, made no eye contact and made us to feel like we were unwelcomed. we basically had to make our own introductions to get our check in process started. His whole demeanor was strange and the interaction awkward. Finally we were asked for our credit card after being surprised by the $17 per day parking fee which was supposed to be free for AAA which wasn't accepted. My husband gave the clerk his card. Almost with glee the clerk announced "Your card was declined!" my husband said this couldn't be. He then said very confrontationaly, "Computers don't lie!". My husband said yes computers do lie. We have more than enough available in our account. The clerk made some other demeaning remark. My husband is pretty aggravated at this point and said well yours is wrong! Mr. Phillips snatched up his monitor and shoved it in my husbands face!!! The whole thing seemed crazy like we were on Candid Camera or something. If we were not exhausted we would've walked right out the door! I read on the screen where it did not say the card was declined. It said an over ride was needed. I even said this to the clerk. He insisted we did not have enough money in our account to pay for the room! My husband decides to call our Bank while waiting on the line for several minutes it is finally found out from our bank that they had no record of the card ever being swiped by Maison St. Charles! My husband handed the card back, he swiped it and voilla it went through!! No apology was ever offered by the clerk! As a matter of fact he never uttered another word to us in the lobby. The clerk just handed us a key and a map. That's it. No good evening, nothing. So we just head out the door to roam around in the rain to find our room. We make it to the end of the courtyard and the clerk comes out and yells, "Hey!!". We turn around and he has a slip and a pen and he says "You didn't sign this!". My husband says well you didn't speak or say anything to us so we left. My husband looks at the receipt and now we are being charged $300 per night base plus taxes and parking!!! He said that wasn't the rate we booked he made a note we do not agree with the rate and signed the slip on the side of the wall. It is pouring rain, very little lighting and it's hard to find where the buildings are. We finally get to our room and get to our door of room 304 and the door will not open. We have to go find maintenance who had a trick! You have to pull up on the lever instead of down and use your shoulder to bust it open. He blamed humidity. And our entire 5 day stay this is what we did to get our door open. The room smelled damp and musty and at times had a odor that came from somewhere smelling of raw sewage. I bought Febreeze spray and sprayed constantly, ran the air, etc. temporary fix when the smells became unbearable. The decorator I could see tried to make this shabby place chic. The decorator is to be commended because they used tricks of the trade, paints, fabrics, etc. to draw your eye away from the poor construction of the place. The place has a lot of potential and could be quite nice if some real construction work were possible. The courtyards are nice with fountains and wrought iron patio sets but could use some more flowers. The lobby was done in a New Orleans funky shabby chic style which I appreciate. They even painted some interesting murals on the exterior walls. The sheets, bedding and towels seemed clean. The walls and carpet were filthy. You will note my pictures of unknown brown stains on the walls and human hairs stuck on the bathroom walls that werent ours. We even had a gigantic roach that was trapped in our bathroom tub. I called the front desk to ask for spray. I waited forever. Finally my husband came back killed it and flushed it. The maintenance man that day did finally show up and said I must've left the door open. Well the next morning we had a smaller roach in the bathroom. On our bank called on Sunday and left a message they were shutting off our account due to suspicious activity. We were panicked while on a tour and had to take time out if our paid tour to call the bank back. Our bank proceeded to tell us someone at Maison St. Charles had tried to charge our card for large amounts several times, 5 in total for varying amounts. They blocked all but the agreed upon charge. Our water went out on Monday mid morning and we were told at front desk it would be on in 10 minutes no apology. My husband waited over an hour. I called the front desk and the young lady said be patient another 20 minutes. My husband needed to shower so we could leave for a timed event and went down and asked the plumber himself and the plumber turned the water on for him but it lasted 5 minutes with cold water shower then the water went off, he just gave up and dried off. Again no apology from staff at all. The maid knocked constantly on our door every morning especially one day when my husband had to work in the room. I told her don't worry just give us towels. She seemed aggravated we wouldn't leave! It was around noon. Next door is a Tapas Restaurant called Santa Fe. I enjoyed their specialty drink The Bill Cosby and the company of the owner and many party loving locals. The crowd gets a little wild at night but hey It's New Orleans! The trolley was always too full to use. But cabs were easy to find. The garden district is nice in the day and a little sketchy at night but using common sense you will be safe. There were some pretty good restaurants on St. Charles and if you like Antiques and vintage finds there's a market across the street. This hotel could be charming if it was staffed by a team of friendly, customer service oriented people, mistakes and problems could be overlooked by guests if at least given an apology. We are very amiable and friendly non demanding people, we are not looking for problems.We felt unwelcomed and like we were a nuisance. We certainly did not get what we paid for. This hotel isn't worth $100 per night, much less $300! We've been to New Orleans no less than 20 times. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great in location and appearance; fabulous desk staff and a comfortable room made for a very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: billfisher
Reviews.Content: Great experience and atmosphere - as always! For my first trip back to New Orleans in several years, I decided to go back to Maison St. Charles. We have stayed there several times over the years and have always had a good experience. The Inn complex is a series of neat old buildings that are well-maintained. We have stayed in other places in NO including some nice places in the French Quarter and prefer Maison St. Charles. It has the charm of some of the neat places in the Quarter without the nastiness or late night noise that often comes with being in the Quarter. The lovely brick courtyard with its fountain and nice wrought iron tables and chairs lured us away from dining at Emeril's Delmonico's, which is about a block (very walkable) away from the Inn. Instead we picked up a nice bottle of port, some phenomenal cheese, almonds and artisan bread from Martin's Wine Cellar and spent a few evening hours in the courtyard chatting. It was very relaxing. There was a rather large gathering at the nearby Daiquiri place but the noise and traffic did not reach us in the courtyard. Our spacious room was well-laid out and clean. The bed was comfortable and the flat screen TV's reception was clear. Located on the street car line not too far away from Lee Circle, the Inn is well-situated for tourists or business travelers. Its proximity to Downtown translates to a quick and easy commute. The World War II Museum is not far away and is a walkable distance. If going to Audubon Park or Zoo, Uptown or to the University Area(Loyola/Tulane), hop on the street car heading the other way. It beats the heck out of driving. The front desk staff has always been very friendly and solicitous. The Continental breakfast was a bit sparse in that the replinishment of the limited items was rather slow and not too happily done (the only employee here I have ever not seen smiling and solicitous).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & unwind from a day and nights of touring and partying!”
Reviews.Author: orlandobop54
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel and perfect for us. We loved being able to get on the trolley and go wherever we wanted without driving and paying for parking. Rooms clean and nice. Great beds and super comfortable. The breakfeast could use a little more fruit & different offerings each day. But very happy overall. Loved the courtyard to relax and enjoy life.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans”
Reviews.Author: vicvitale
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff was nice but A little scary when we checked in 3/18/2012 on the corner they were tons of people standing around drinking and very loud. TV reception was horrible. streetcar was very handy to catch. We ate at ZEA and SUPERIOR GRILL on ST. CHARLES, both very good.

Reviews.Title: “Service was really good”
Reviews.Author: Alemabahiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at Quality Inn & Suites Maison St. Charles. We enjoyed our stay, especially because of the quiet location and the staff. Unfortunately I forgot some of my shopping bags in the hotel and the house and cleaning departement did everything that I got it sent in time. It was really good service. French quarter can be reached easily by train, Garden disdrict is right at the corner. We would definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's the only good thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KLfromMCO
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to New Orleans. The three previous visits we stayed at the W in the French Quarter and loved it. But this time we were traveling for a wedding. The wedding party was staying at the Maison St. Charles. Because of that and because the photos looked OK, we opted to stay there, too. We will not be back. The location is great. It's right across the street from the trolley. The trolley is a cheap ride into the French Quarter or you can take it the opposite direction down St. Charles and visit the zoo and other tourist attractions. The rooms have been updated, but need more TLC. Even though the decor had been updated, it still felt dated and grimy. The knobs in the bathtub hadn't been sealed and could be wiggled and jiggled. The room had a fridge. When we opened it to put some water inside, we discovered a gross smell which turned out to be a ziplock bag filled with meat that was crammed in the freezer. Gross. Breakfast is included. The usual continental breakfast type fare. You can eat in the patio area. There's a small pool, but we didn't use it. The lobby staff was not helpful and gave us wrong information regarding events and transportation. For example, they told us they'd arrange a cab for a 3:30 a.m. ride to the airport. They didn't and instead we were standing in the street, hailing a cab in the middle of the night with our luggage and four-year-old daughter. Stressful and scary! If you end up in this part of town, be sure to try Slice. It's a funky pizza place with unusual slices, a variety of tasty beers and desserts. Also a few blocks down the street was The Irish House, which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: CEO108
Reviews.Content: I took my group down here for a pre-cruise one night stay at the Maison St. Charles and we all were super satisfied. Not too far from the downtown area but the trolley stops right in front of the hotel. The rooms were elegant and so inexpensive. Great location, Great Staff! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pick!”
Reviews.Author: kemistry2000
Reviews.Content: I searched a long time for the perfect hotel for us--price, location and amenities. This one was just right! I am glad we did not stay in the French Quarter--this was a much better location to base ourselves. The staff was very nice. I requested a refrigerator and microwave and we got them promply at no extra cost. The room was fine, clean and had everything we needed. The hotel is right on a St Charles street car stop. But beware--if you are depending on the street car to go everywhere--don't. Many times it was too full to pick us up and we waited over an hour one time while several cars went by us full--take a cab! They are easy plentiful but a little pricey--put that in your budget or rent a car.(I bet parking is a pain though)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great price and location.”
Reviews.Author: gwinterboer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which was really nice in size. The location of the hotel was great since it was close to the St. Charles street car. I would suggest this to hotel to someone who wants to stay close to the fun but away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Gool Location, gool value on St Charles St”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeFamly
Reviews.Content: Stay 2 nights in Mar 2012 Located on St Charles st in the garden district. Rooms were clean & comfortable. continental breakfast was good. Ft desk & hotel staff was good, free WiFi, nice pool and hot tube. Various shop, restaurants & coffee houses alone St charles st. Street car stop is literally across the street. Good Value will Stay again

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm...less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: Layne C
Reviews.Content: I was excited about this hotel and location before I got there. I don't believe that this hotel is in a safe area. I felt very vulnerable. Gates were left open at night, my room was tucked away in the corner and it just did not feel right. I should have spent more money. I guess it is a trade off but my safety is not worth getting a good price on a hotel. In general the room was OK. Also beware some taxi drivers try to get more money when going to this hotel saying it is in a different district. There should be no taxi surcharge when going to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, cute room.”
Reviews.Author: broadwayjen
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable! Right in front of the trolley line. Within walking distance of several good restaurants. The rooms decor is unique and cute. There is a small hot tub and pool in the courtyard. Very happy with the value of this hotel, I am sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice courtyards to sit and enjoy the day.”
Reviews.Author: LuvsBears
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. Beds were comfy and room was clean. Everytime we went out of our room their was security guards doing there job. Street car access was great, never had to wait very long. We didn't use street car at night, instead we used taxi cab. I would agree that nighttime is a little sketchy around that area, we were told not to go near bridges or any further then the street we were on after dark. There is an amazing pizza joint a few doors down that had the best lasagna and pizza. We passed a couple homeless people laying just off the sidewalk and a group of hoodies, and a drug deal going on during our walk to the restaurant. we walked a little faster going back! If your not a nightclub person this is a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, value for money, great breakfast, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Allan C
Reviews.Content: We booked this place because the weekend that we went to New Orleans it was hard to find a reasonably priced room. I'm glad we stayed here because it was more than adequate. The grounds are fairly attractive with nice gardens and courtyards. The hotel you can tell is older but you can also tell effort has been put in to keep it contemporary and appealing. The rooms are average to good - nothing special. The breakfast was satisfying. There was the usual toast, cereal, baked goods, coffee but there was also omelette style and hard boiled eggs, breakfast sausages, juices, yogurt and fruit. The location's benefits are that it is not far from the downtown area but is far enough to avoid the hustle and bustle. The street car is easy to catch although for someone new to the concept it was hard to figure out the timing. We ended up twice just taking a cab because we were waiting for too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MattP343
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise! The location is great, conveniently located on St. Charles between the French Quarter and the Garden District, along the trolley line (with a stop right out front). Also, several Mardi Gras parades (Uptown) go right past the door. I loved the courtyard atmosphere and the multiple buildings. It gives the motel a little seclusion from the street and neighborhood. The price is affordable, especially considering its location. The rooms aren't fancy, but very nice, clean, and comfortable. The decor is nice, fitting to the neighborhood. The beds were amazingly comfortable. There are several restaurants within a couple blocks, anywhere from Wendy's and Popeye's next door, to Emeril's Delmonico across the street. There is a charge for parking in the somewhat secure lot. AAA members can receive free parking, but only if the room is booked through the AAA website, so be sure to compare rates.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: evangeline57
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 wks at the end of January/beginning of February which is a "slower" period in New Orleans. Although it IS winter, and this is a warm weather destination, most Snowbirds tend to visit at Halloween, before and during Christmas, or in the couple of weeks leading up to Mardi Gras. This is important because the rigid rates at the Maison St Charles do not really reflect this slow period. Other reviewers seem pleased with the rates they received, but I wonder if they understand that many fine rooms in the Fr Qtr were going for $89-$99/night at the same time they were paying $109-$129/night here. I myself stayed at the Place D'Armes, right next to Jackson Square, the week before moving here, and my bill averaged $99/night there. Which brings us to the matter of the location. Maison St Charles is always being praised for its terrific location because it is halfway between the French Qtr and the Garden District. While that may be geographically true, any seasoned traveler knows that halfway between 2 highly desirable locations, can often leave you in "No Man's Land". While that is not exactly the case here, it is pretty close. First, the Streetcar issue: Yes, the St Charles Ave line does stop right outside the door. Problem is, this close to town, it is almost always packed with other riders by the time it makes it in this far (Erato St by the overpass). We literally NEVER took the streetcar INBOUND from here; always gave up and walked the 25 mins into town. Given the rich foods we were eating, and the fact that we are healthy and good walkers to begin with, this was not a huge issue, but I think it really could present a problem to older or more sedentary visitors. Next, the Neighborhood: In the immediate area are Lee Circle, the WWII, Civil War and Ogden Museums; also, Emeril's DelMonico and a couple of ordinary restaurants in the proximate 2 blocks of St Charles. Then there is that "Daquiri Bar" on the corner, which is seedy looking and literally has people lying on the ground in front of it. (This did not happen once, but every single day we were there.) The Wendy's next door and the Popeye's and KFC on the next blocks could be convenient, I suppose, if you had children with you, but otherwise they just function as hangouts for the area kids who slow down service by gabbing with their friends behind the counter. Finally, Safety: There is onsite Security, but the iron gates on both sides of the driveway are left open all day and only closed at night. This allows free access to the Hotel property all day long through the Wendy's driveway. Twice I witnessed two young men who walked in this way early in the morning, went directly to the breakfast room, loaded up plates, and left together, via the other side of the driveway. Maybe they were guests who like to walk and eat at the same time?? Since we hiked into town so many times, we tried several different routes and found that, within a few blocks, are a public housing building (St Charles at Lee Circle) and a homeless men's shelter (Camp St by St Patrick's Church). All in all, I would rate the location as pretty dicey, especially for women. Now for the Hotel itself: The Lobby is smallish, but attractive with shabby chic furniture and tile floors. There is a single computer here which had an "Out of Order" sign on it for several days of our stay. We were in a nicely decorated, good-sized, ground floor Double Queen room which was a little musty when we first arrived. I got a bottle of Febreeze, cranked up the Air Conditioner, and left the door open for about half an hour. Problem solved. To be honest, this is a common problem in New Orleans, so again no biggie for us, but if you have serious allergies, best beware. . . Also, the tub/shower area was just disgusting, with brown stained acoustic ceiling panels, peeling wall paper, and a plastic mat glued to the bottom of the tub in an attempt to cover still obvious stains below. Again, I got disinfectant at the CVS downtown and scrubbed like crazy before I set a toenail in there. Complete overhaul of the bath is needed. There was a crack in the vanity near the floor which I plugged up with paper after killing a roach (just one; it's New Orleans) on the sink. One of the headboards was in really bad shape and should be replaced ('nuff said about that). One of the lamps was non-functional for the entire period we were there. The Internet is free, and worked fairly well, but was completely inacessible one whole night and part of the next morning. The in-room safe was too small for a full-size laptop. The hairdryer had low power and should be replaced. The in-room coffeemaker looked as if it had never been cleaned, so again, I did it myself. Cable offers poor selection and erratic signal sometimes goes out completely. I know most people don't come to New Orlean to watch TV, but we were in town for an extended stay and after a while you just miss Mr Ed! (Get METV.) The outside is very pretty, although that inside courtyard is a little weird-- seems like a wasted space to me. People smoke throughout the grounds, which are fairly noisy, and one night we even had to open the door to protest prolonged pounding next door where another guest had bolted the door on his roomie (I know this was not the Hotel's fault, but where was Security?). Jazz is played outside, which gives the space a nice vibe during the day and evening, but it is a little loud early in the morning and late at night. The Laundry facility was very helpful and Breakfast was fine with hot and cold options; only suggestion is to add herbal teabags. The Staff was distant and seemed to spend a good deal of time talking to each other, rather than exuding the customary New Orleans warmth towards its guests. As mentioned above, we moved here after a week in the French Qtr, thinking a week of the downtown maddness would be enough, and we would welcome both a little quiet, and an opportunity to explore the Garden District, Mid-City, and Audobon Park areas more thoroughly. We did all of that, and I have to admit that we were reasonably comfortable at the Maison St Charles, but I doubt if we will return. We were there for a faily long stay (2 wks) and no one ever asked if the room was okay, or if we needed anything. Really, what you are getting here are mediocre accommodations and practically no hospitality. They just don't seem to care whether you are there or not. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you love St. Charles Ave........”
Reviews.Author: Pip18Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: If you love St. Charles Ave and the Garden District ..... this is the place for you. Charming courtyards, big comfortable rooms, New Orleans/mardi gras theme. Easy to hop on the streetcar to the French Quarter plus many restaurants close by. An excellent location and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ziplineboss
Reviews.Content: I was here just this week with my wife and two children (12 and 10). Rooms were clean. The price was awesome (compared to other properties in the area). Staff was very accommodating and respectful. There is a street car stop right out front on St. Charles St. so once you are parked you can leave your own car there and use the street car. Nice and quaint. Breakfast was sufficient. Pool are was clean and small hot tub was adequate for us. 24 hour security added to my satisfaction. Would highly recommend. (keep in mind, it is a Quality Inn, it is NOT the Ritz Carleton, but for what it is, it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down Room, Misquoted on Room Rate”
Reviews.Author: Zonker123
Reviews.Content: My wife called the hotel directly to make a reservation. She was told that our rate included the parking fee. When she printed out her reservation, she noticed that the parking fee was on there. She called the hotel and was told that parking could never be free. She was directed to call another number to ask about this. Again, she was told that parking was never free. The new number told her to call the hotel and maybe ask for the manager. My wife did, and she was told that she would be connected to the manager's line. She was cut off. She called back, and the lady said she would put her through to the manager, and that the manager was waiting for her call. She put her through and the manager did not answer. My wife called back and said that the manager didn't answer. The lady apologized and finally got her through to the manager. The manager said parking is never free. My wife said why did they quote her that? The manager did not have an answer but agreed to honor the first quote. When we got there, of course, they said that we would have to pay for parking. We had to explain everything again, and my wife read off the list of names she talked to at the hotel about this. One of the names had a magic quality to it because suddenly we did not have to pay for parking anymore. All this for $17. On to the room. This is not really an inn or suites. More like an outdoor motel, with all the doors facing outside. Cobblestone walkway/driveways lead you to the rooms. There appears to be a phase one and phase two to the hotel. It appears we got Phase One. The room was very small, our door did not open all the way (Room 138). It had the old time combo heat/air unit. Room was kind of run down and rough looking. Hair dryer didn't work. You always knew when the people upstairs were walking around. You always knew when someone was rolling their bags to their room because of the cobblestones. Trash truck came on Sunday morning at about 5am. Lots of banging and listening to a diesel engine rumble for about 15 minutes. Positive - breakfast was okay and included. Fake eggs and such, but not bad. Pool and jacuzzi looked okay. Negative - Front desk should have known that my wife was coming from a mile away. They could have planned a little to make sure she was happy. They didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Never Even Checked In & Lied to by Front Desk Manager”
Reviews.Author: RK_Birmingham
Reviews.Content: I called to cancel my reservation because of a family emergency. I was assured that I would be refunded and/or not charged for my room if the room was resold. I book during the BCS Championship Game so I know the room could have been resold easily. I even found a friend of mine and had them call the hotel directly asking for a room. They were told they were booked and had no cancellations. Upon calling back the following week and speaking with the front desk manager again. She informed me they were not able to sell the room. I asked why my friends were told no rooms available and she played dumb like she didn't know. I asked for a refund because I felt lied to and fraudulently deceived by the hotel. She declined and said there was nothing she was going to do and that I could dispute it with my credit card company. She was very rude. I asked to speak to the general manager and was put into his voicemail. This was almost a week ago now and I've yet to receive a call from the general manager or any further follow-up from the hotel what-so-ever. I would never recommend this place because of the rude and inconsiderate staff. AND I NEVER EVEN STAYED AT THE HOTEL. It's bad when you have a horrible experience and you never even set foot on the hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: manniac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the BCS title game. We enjoyed our stay at the Maison St. Charles Inn and Suites. We could get away from all of the crowds in the French Quarter, but we were close enough to see it anytime we wanted. RTR.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best!”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: There for the BCS game. Perfect in everyway! Without a doubt will stay there when I come back to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ggandsteve
Reviews.Content: You expect a hotel in New Orleans to not have the "corporate feel" of the large chains to be authentic. The Maison St. Charles conveyed the feel of old New Orleans, while providing the comforts of the 21st century. It was very clean and we felt safe. While some of the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, and the fixtures were a bit dated, you would expect that level of charm in Louisiana. At first it seemed that this place was too far away from the older part of town where all the "action" was, however, the trolley passes right out front and takes you directly to canal street where you can walk to Bourbon Street or the French Quarter, or connect to additional trolleys or pedicabs to other points of the city. The only negative thing we have to say is that when trying to pay at the front desk with cash for our room we seem to have rattled their cages somewhat. We tried to give them cash up front in addition to having our credit card on file. They didn't want the cash until we checked out....oh well.

Reviews.Title: “VERY new orleans”
Reviews.Author: k w
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT. The best way to describe the hotel is "very new orleans". This hotel is a collection of buildings built in different centuries - some are historical - built in the 1700s, some are more recent as in the last 30 years (maybe) - so it is very eclectic. The rooms are decorated in a very new orleans style...dark wood, stripes, gold and purple...kind of cool. The rooms are comfortable but need some additional updating - it looks like they started, but then stopped - mainly in the bathrooms... My only gripe is that the rooms (mainly the bathrooms) were not very clean - It didn't feel (or look) sanitary - they could use a thorough bleaching. The staff was VERY nice and helpful, and made some great dining recommendations, and it was great to have a trolley stop right outside the front door. We got our room at an excellent price, so I was happy for what we paid. If we paid more, I may have been upset. I would stay here again for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sylviabeana415510
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, traveling with our 3 kids, we booked the 2 room, 2 bedroom suite. The suite was great for our family. We all had the room we needed. The staff is polite and helpful, always had answers for us and tried to help. The hotel offers free breakfast and wihi. The location has its ups and downs. It is located right in front of the St charles street car, which passed regularly and is only $1.25 per person to take you directly to Canal St. Our room was street side so we heard the street cars pass during the night. Overall it is a great deal and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: rainemd
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and efficient - the rooms were clean and comfortable - however they were a bit outdated and have to be renovated. The bathrooms also have to be improved since it's quite old and it takes awhile for the plumbing to work. The breakfast was tasty and adequate. Wifi free and OK. But the best part is the the location. It is perfect since the trolley / tram service is just outside the hotel. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Meehhh...”
Reviews.Author: TexasChat
