Reviews.Content: This is an hodgepodge hotel. The pictures are deceiving, the hotel is behind the lobby in different buildings. The parking is across the street not in the same location as the hotel kinda off putting.The parking lot is gated and there are two cameras on top of a thirty foot building. THis is a pet friendly hotel so BEWARE!! Other people that bring there dogs that yap all through the night and all morning can be irritating..And there is NO compensation for it!!! Which happened to us. The microwave in the room did not work but was replaced with a new one when I called about it. The hotel itself seemed to be falling apart with a fresh coat of paint on it.There is a saying looks good from the freeway it fits this place perfect!! also in all the reviews they say you can take the trolly in to the french quarter, well the trolly was always full. We walked most of the time or took a cab..All in all I wish I would have sprang for a more expensive hotel rather than save a few bucks here..o the breakfast is disgusting wouldn't feed it to my dog that i left at home.....

Reviews.Title: “Just okay - average”
Reviews.Author: sail0r0ne
Reviews.Content: We had trouble with the room smelling like cigarettes - there solution was to send someone over with Febreeze. We said no... so, they moved us to another room. Front desk staff is efficient and quick - just an average place to stay for one night + one weird neighborhood. We parked on the side street with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jess_RGS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I debated if we were going to give this a 3 or a 4. In all honesty, it is an average hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, there is a nice pool and hot tub, and the continental breakfast was very tasty. The extra bit for me, though, was how convenient the location of the hotel is. During the day, you can walk to the French Quarter (I don't think I'd make that walk at night, though) very easily. For those who don't like to do a lot of walking, it is right across the street from where the trolley line picks up. We had a car with us (we got a special off season deal that waved the parking charge, which was awesome) and found that the hotel was also in a great, central locations for all of the other things in New Orleans that we were wanting to do. The only negative for me was that the internet was rather slow. Both my husband and I needed to take care of a few business issues while we were there, so the internet speed was a tad frustrating. But, it is free Wifi, which is fantastic, and for things like checking e-mail or Facebook or pulling up a map to figure out how to get where you are going it isn't too bad. The staff was very friendly and helpful no matter what we had a question about. I think we would probably stay here again if we were going back to New Orleans, if we could get another off-season deal (it was through TravelZoo). That really made it a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location on St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed Nov 5-8 2011 and couldnt have chosen a better hotel. Just a few steps from the trolley car line, the staff was wonderful, decor and history of the hotel is great, to boot, parking is minimal cost and continential breakfast is include. We have had many stays in New Orleans at top notch hotels and this one by far, surpassed the bigger hotels. Really enjoyed sitting out in the courtyard(s) with views of beautiful landscape and nice little pool. If you enjoy a evening cocktail, you'll need to bring your own or walk across the street for one. This was the most memoriable trip we have every had to New Orleans and we have are already started planning our next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “diane and andy from Maine”
Reviews.Author: Diane c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Nov.17- 22, 2011.We found this hotel was very quaint and had a lot of class.The hotel lobby and our room decor was really nice.We enjoyed sitting in the courtyard and found this hotel to be quiet. The staff and security were very helpful and pleasant.The continental breakfast had a very good selection of items and the seating area felt like we were in a small cafe in Paris.We left our car in the hotels gated parking lot and we took the streetcar across the street from the hotel.We would definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: shannon t
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convientently located near the trolly car route. The french quarter is easily accessible without the higher coast of closer hotels. This hotel is beautiful with georgous court yards. Very impressed. In the future, I will always stay here while in NOLA>

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a weekend in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: graceyb123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend with two friends in November, each couple had booked a king size double and we were really happy with the rooms! We arrived at the hotel and went to check in. There was a bit of confusion at the front desk as the clerk only gave us one room key, even though we had two rooms booked. Luckily, as soon as we told her we infact had two rooms booked she sorted it out quickly and put us in a room next to our friends. We stayed in rooms 334 & 335, which were at the back of the hotel complex in the corner, but still had a view of the pool if you stood in the hallway. The rooms were just what we needed, an excellent size, with a lovely sink area and clean bathroom with massage shower head! To my suprise the room had all the facilities we could have needed, including a coffee maker, a microwave, fridge, hairdryer, and ironing board and iron, very useful, and all of which was very clean also. The bed was comfortable and linen was clean, the room itself was also to a very high standard, we slept very well in the 2 nights we stayed here. The breakfast was also very good, included hot coffee & tea, bagels with cream cheese, and toast with choices of jams, also hot food served such as sausages, eggs, and waffles. We opted for cereal, bagels and yoghurts, which were all of a good quality and set us up well for the days of exploring the city. One afternoon we returned to the hotel early and made use of the pool and jacuzzi. The pool wasn't the cleanest it could have been, with some leaves etc in the bottom, the jacuzzi also had some debris at the bottom of it, but we didnt really mind, but perhaps could have been monitored more. The Jacuzzi was always on, and the area in itself was quiet too so it was a nice extra to our stay; we even took some of our own drinks and snacks down to the poolside tables in the evening and sat there drinking before we went out, which didnt seem to be a problem. Parking was fine, an additional $17 per day, which was quite a lot, but it was convenient as only a 1 minute walk to the side gate of the hotel. Location is good, if you want it there is a Wendy's right next door, and various other shops and restaurants along the street. The best part of the Inn's location is the streetcar stop which is literally across the road, one way taking you towards the rest of the Garden district, Zoo, and University, the other direction taking you to the CBD and French Quater, which is about 15 mins by streetcar, but also walkable if you have time. All in all a great place to stay, myself and my partner enjoyed it very much, and our friends did too. We would use this place again if we return to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great price off season - pretty room”
Reviews.Author: Mary_and_Jim
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans in November, so got a great AAA rate that included free parking (usually $17 a day). The St. Louis suite was a 2 room suite, really pretty, chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, very period looking. Room was clean and linens were nice. Breakfast was typical continental breakfast. We were right on the trolley line, so were able to take the trolley everywhere and not have to drive. Only downsides -- internet was down for the entire trip, very inconvenient as we'd planned our trip online. The hotel apologized and give us some extra "points". In the bathtub only the shower worked, couldn't take a bath. Shower head needed replacing. The strangest thing -- the cold water faucet in the sink was hot water - even after running a minute or two. The hot faucet was VERY hot. Never could get cold water in the sink.

Reviews.Title: “We celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kinford728
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I wanted to go somewhere special for our 15th wedding anniversary. So we chose this hotel over some of the more upscale ones. Most of the time when travelers choose a chain hotel you get what you pay for, but this hotel went above what we expected. The staff was so courteuos to us, from housekeeping to the front desk. It more than met our expectations. The breakfast was superb,we wished we had discovered it earlier!!! Special thanks to Irma & Juliet in the breakfast room for helping my husband. We also liked the spa, it feels good to someone with arthritis.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tammy O
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maison St. Charles for the weekend. Upon arriving in our room, we had to wonder if it had even been cleaned. We found some dirty clothes obviously left behind by a previous guest in the floor of the closet in plain sight. Do not see how a maid could have missed them. The door was very hard to open and close. Although we were not in the room very much, you still do not want to wonder if it has been cleaned. Also paying $17.00 a day to park in a self parking lot across the street is a little excessive. The Wendy's next store is disgusting and smells inside and out. Not sure if I would stay there again. Upon check out we were told they could not print us a receipt but would email it to us. Still have not received it.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Elton74
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans again for Halloween 2011 and our room was much, much better than the last time we stayed at Maison St Charles. The room was larger, for one. The bathroom, which was my biggest gripe last time, was seemingly newly renovated and much cleaner. My problem with the bathroom this time was that the shower head was weak and too low for my 6'1, and that's about it. The big problem was that there was television signal for only about two or three hours during our entire stay, meaning I missed the World Series game 6 - luckily the sound worked. The desk told us it was normal. Huh? Thankfully we were out visiting the French Qtr or Garden District most of the time or I'd be much angrier. I love the place. Perfect location and it's quaint. We look forward to staying here again next October. This was a much better stay than our 2009 visit...

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: K-Buc
Reviews.Content: this place was so cute and so unexpected! It fit right into what i thought a " New Orlenas" hotel should be and the price was WONDERFUL! the little streets and each little separate courtyard, make it seem lie a tiny neighborhood! We will FOR SURE go back again! It is right on the St Charles Streetcar line, and you can get an all day pass (for any of the streetcars and buses) for 3 dollars and ride all day! Absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jputnam2011
Reviews.Content: Had the honeymoon suite. The Degas suite. It is awesome. Beautiful room very intimate. Great tub and stand up glass shower. Great balcony overlooking the pool. Breakfast was good, nice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and quiet stay.”
Reviews.Author: kaceegirl
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 5 and 2 rooms. The rooms were typical size and adequate for our stay. We found the employees at the front desk to be very friendly and accommodating. We liked the location because it was on the St. Charles Ave. streetcar line, so we could just park our car and get around where we wanted by riding the streetcar. We would probably stay there the next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Now associated with Quality Inn and Suites...”
Reviews.Author: tallygirl21
Reviews.Content: The hotel setting is New Orleans style with wrought iron, courtyard, etc. You can tell it used to be a really good place but it needs a little TLC now. On the other hand, price was good, $80 a night with our Choice Group connection and AAA discount. For this area, that is a good deal. It is a distance from French Quarter, etc. but streetcars run right in front of hotel and for $3.00 you can ride all day. Beds were very comfy and rooms had a flat screen TV, frig, and microwave. Shower/ bathtub should be replaced in my opinion. Also, hard to adjust water, got very hot quickly so beware! Sink faucets seemed to always have warm or hot water. Door was hard to open and safe was so dirty with handprints I was not about to use it. Staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was fine. I hope they are able to put some money into this place and bring back the New Orleans place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in historical settings”
Reviews.Author: Pepetito
Reviews.Content: This is not a typical Quality Inn however it's run by this chain now. The hotel is terribly nice as it is consisted of several converted historical buildings in downtown NO. There is one issue to consider before booking. Normally Quality Inns come with free parking for their guests. But this one charges $17+tax per day for 1 place. The guest becomes aware of this small circumstance only when charged for entire stay on check-out because nobody warns about it on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mklopp
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to New Orleans many times and stayed in dozens of hotels. I think this one is my favorite. This hotel is quite large, although you would never know it. There are several buildings, but each has its own courtyard. The rooms are comfortable, the staff are efficient and pleasant and a decent breakfast is included. The price is reasonable as well. In addition to all this, the St Charles streetcar stop is across the street from the hotel. Canal St and the French Quarter is about a mile from the hotel, but if you don't feel like walking, the streetcar stops every 5-10 minutes. It doesn't get much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bholt9359
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate directly from Choice Hotels; felt we got a very good deal. Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. The room was cute, but (at least ours) was not the charming rooms full of character mostly featured on their site. I think those were the more expensive suites; ours was a pretty standard room with a little New Orleans flair. Absolutely appreciated having plenty of towels and washcloths. The beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was very good with the exception of one day they only exchanged towels due to the tropical storm, but that was no big deal. The hotel complex itself is very unique. I loved the older buildings on the property and seeing the photos in the breakfast area. There is a nice patio area we were unable to enjoy due to the rain, but it would be a great space in more enjoyable weather. The complimentary breakfast was on the better side, especially during the weekend. The breakfast area itself is in one of the older buildings and is full of character. We were okay with the location. I can see how one might find it beneficial to be more in the French Quarter area but we also went to the Garden District and a few other area and found it to be centrally located. There are several good restaurants and a nice tavern as well as a Walgreen's in a five-block area. The street car runs right in front of the hotel, but we really could never figure out the schedule, nor was there a covered waiting area, so it didn't work out too well for us in the pouring rain. It quit running early in our trip anyway due to the storm. We took cabs or walked mostly. Just a few cons I feel I should mention: The hotel has older doors in the lobby and I found it awkward to try to get in and out of them with luggage. I know they're probably not trying to alter the historic aspects of the building, but maybe something could be done to make it a little easier to get in and out. Our door to our room was also very tight and required us to "put a shoulder into it" to open every time. Our shower curtain rod was damaged and didn't allow the shower curtain to close correctly, so we got the floor soaked with every shower. But other than those small things I was satisfied and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Joseph G
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Wonderful Staff / Guest Services manager was very professional.Love This Hotel Very clean Everyone makes you feel so at home. will be back .

Reviews.Title: “Adequate And functional hotel for an "away from the madness" location....”
Reviews.Author: PauletteOliva
Reviews.Content: Dropping my freshman off at Tulane, I was "stranded" in New Orleans because of Hurricane Irene - the hotel was very accommodating to provide the extra night without moving my room. Because I arrived rather early initially, the only room ready was up on the third flor of the "historical" building - (read: old) in the attic. The rooms was functional, shower pressure was horrible, and the bathroom was old, toilet paper holder knocked off the wall...it just needs a bit of TLC, with the peeling wall paper, etc. The a/c worked but you couldn't heat yourself think. The service was pleasant, guards on duty, so you felt relatively safe. $17 per day to park is a bit much, but perhaps the locked facility is necessary in this neighborhood. The hotel is attached to a great Tapa restaurant , "Santa Fe" with the most gracious owners Charlotte, and her husband - ate there twice, even though Emeril's Delmonico was right across the street. All in all it was "okay" and would probably stay there again, given it's "warts" because, I would know enough to ask for a building with an elevator, instead of the three floor walk -up, and the location is actually very good. The value isn't bad for New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaD0527
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I spent three nights at Maison St. Charles in a lovely suite. It was beautifully appointed and well cared for. The service was great, from the General Manager to the housekeeping staff. The complimentary brunch was excellent. The hotel's location is ideal - close enough to the French Quarter, and easy access to the city's wonderful streetcars. There's no doubt that we'll stay there again when next we visit The Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BARGAIN IN NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Jade-Blue53
Reviews.Content: After searching for hotels I decided to stay at Maison St. Charles despite the negative reviews. Room was clean enough and charming, court yard was very nice, breakfast wasn't that good but it was free, location was fine never felt afraid to be out at night. Staff didn't go out of their way to be helpful and/or friendly, but they weren't rude either. Over all this hotel was good, and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Passable and Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: Kreskin2207
Reviews.Content: I had a super early flight into New Orleans so when I wasn't able to check into my room at 10AM I wasn't too surprised. That said, I find it hard to believe every room at this hotel was booked on a Thursday night, leading to my Friday night reservation. It was a standard answer and procedure, which I understand, but have stayed in other New Orleans hotels which allowed me in early, so I'll keep that in mind for future visiting. The hotel is laid out very interestingly. You walk in from St. Charles into the lobby. On each side of the lobby there is a circle driveway that leads to the parking lot. It's kind of hard to explain, but imagine a horseshoe with the lobby in the middle and behind the circle you have the rooms. There's one or two historic looking houses/buildings converted into rooms, then more of a traditional hotel behind that. We were in the converted older style building. Our room, unsurprisingly, was very small (located on the second floor in the corner). I expect rooms in New Orleans and other cities to be small so it wasn't a huge deal. I did, however, look in the windows of some other rooms (in the same building) and they were quite large(r). I probably got shafted because I booked through Orbitz and got a super (low) rate....just a guess... The carpeting in the room looked to be fairly new and the bedding was comfortable and clean. (Just an FYI, they do charge a deposit to your credit card for damages based on your length of stay.) Hopefully I won't get dinged for the bathroom door that was hanging off the hinges (you had to pick up the door and push in the hinge to get it to close.) The shower was clean enough but there was some sort of a black discoloration above the shower (guessing some sort of mold.) One of the main issues we had with our room was that there was NO cold water...zero. Imagine being in New Orleans in August...cold water would come in handy. Turn the cold side of the sink...all warm...turn the shower...lukewarm. Terrible. The AC did work fairly well though, would be hard not to be able to cool such a small room. The front desk staff was okay, not very outgoing or helpful. I didn't try the pool, but I heard some other guests talking about how it was out of order. There was also breakfast served daily but I didn't get to check that out. One final drawback is the location. It's a great location for catching the street car (just across the street) and a 5-7 minute ride to the Quarter but its around several fast food restaurants which leads to some less than spectacular interactions. I'm not going to return to this hotel. Just not worth the risk when there are comparable hotels at very comparable rates in the city. If you get a super rate and are in town for a short stay you'll be fine. I'm sure you've stayed in worse, I have.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans trip”
Reviews.Author: popcrnluvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Maison st. charles on July 29-Aug. 2, 2011. The hotels is located in a old home, which understandably means the rooms will smell kinda old, but the room was clean and we enjoyed our stay. My only complains was the television reception in one of the rooms was bad and the internet connection is poor at best. Don't bother bring your laptop. There is a computer in the front lobby and you can use it. Personnel are helpful and friendly. Enjoyed our stay, St. charles trolley is right in front of the hotel and parking is safe across street, but that is no problem, plenty of security. Breakfast is good enough. all in all I enjoyed the atmospher of living in old new orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tessbroz
Reviews.Content: This is the best deal in NOLA. Beautiful, charming, and quaint hotel close enough to the action (taxi, streetcar) of Bourbon St. but far enough to get away from the craziness. Great area. The only downfall is the staff. They really aren't too friendly or helpful. No southern hospitality here. Free parking fro AAA members with card.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! NOT GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: Angelica R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not how it's pictured AT ALL on (booking.com) didn't get around to taking pics because too worried bout checking out ASAP. As I was traveling with young kids...it was the wrong hotel for them for sure. Bad neighborhood...not 2 blocks away, as someone earlier stated..its right there...eek. The desk employees were not friendly at all...but the rest of the staff was very nice and friendly and helpful! the Breakfast was quite good. room sufficiently clean but the AIR could not find happy medium. either freezing cold or icky hot. This hotel definitely fine for 20 somethings and couples with no kids.BUT the beds and pillows were not comfy at all. The parking was idiocy to say the least. "30 feet" approx. from Wendy's fast food joint, Popeye's block away. Voodoo BBQ couple blocks away (heard that was a good place to eat) but didn't feel comfortable taking the kids out at night. All in all would never stay here again. Oh, p.s. they do have a security guard on duty ...who definitely looks like he can take care any issues...but that made it all the more...hmmm they need him hanging in the parking area just outside the hotel, I must not be in a great area. again just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...Worse place I have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: LadySkye
Reviews.Content: Just awful. I requested a Suite with a nice view and a balcony. We had to climb 3 flights of stairs to get to the room. Very steep steps. When we opened the door we found ourselves in an attic. The windows were about a foot tall and the only thing we could see was the brick wall of the next building. No balcony. The sofa was horribly stained. It looked like someone has urinated all over it. The furniture looked like it came from a garage sale. It was old and the paint was peeling and not one piece matched. There was no tub. When you truned on the water it sprayed out in gusts. The television was all snowy. The air conditioner was not working correcty and would not cool off. I called and ask for another room and was told this was the only suite. They also said there were no more rooms. To get ice we had to leave the building ( 3 flights of stairs), cross to the next building and climb another set of stairs. This was the most disgusting awful room I have ever had the displeasure of staying in. Please do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Funky Room”
Reviews.Author: evd91
Reviews.Content: We were delighted when we first opened the door to the suite (room 145), with its high ceilings, chandeliers and pocket doors. However, the room smelled so musty (and strongly of urine) that we went out and purchased an Air-Wick to use during our stay. Closer inspection revealed that the chandeliers were cob-webby and other areas of the room badly needed dusting. Someone else's cosmetics were found in both the nightstand and the writing desk, and the two trash cans were so tiny as to be useless. Tiny bathroom too, so if you're a "person of size", you'll have trouble closing the door to use the toilet. The complimentary breakfast is best skipped (those horrible pre-cooked "omelets" and weird link sausages), but there are good places to eat within walking distance. On the positive side, the outdoor courtyard is very pleasant during nice weather, and the location on the St. Charles streetcar line gets you around town very conveniently. Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'll be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Better than before”
Reviews.Author: ZydecoGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and after Katrina. It was a good value before but new management (it's now a quality inn property) is doing a great job of taking care of small details from cleaning the interior of the elevators to making sure the ice machines are working and grooming the landscaping. There were flat screen TVs installed and the bed was comfy and the sheets smelled (and were) very clean and fresh. The on site bar is gone. It's been absorbed for use during the continental breakfast offering, which is decent--bagels, cereal, sausage, prefab omlets, yogurt, toast, do it yourself waffles and juices. With an adjacent tapas restaurant and bar and the 24 hour St. Charles tavern up the street, the property bar was superfluous so that's not a loss. The rooms have been updated . With a microwave and frig, taking home those wonderful leftovers from area restaurants for a late night snack is possible. We also had a desk and table. Secured parking was free with our AAA rate. Where can you get 4 nights for less than $300 so close to the River front and Quarter with good casual and upscale restaurants close by (and an Office Depot) that's quiet and clean. Downsides? The wifi was very spotty and pretty much non existant in our building. There is wifi at the St. Charles Tavern and at Office Max near by and the wifi works better in the hotel lobby. The little european sized pillows on our king bed were annoying. I The tub has been retrofitted with a fiberglass shell and surround so that it's very narrow. It's hard to reach the tiny grab bar in the front. An older or very large person should stick with a shower to be safe. The lobby computer was down but staff let me use one of their computers to print out a boarding pass. All in all, the St. Charles Maison is better than before. It's not a luxury hotel, but it's a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “I suppose you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: kurtzb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at Maison St Charles. The hotel is ok. There was nothing amazing nor anything horrendous to report - though the lack of clean towels after the housekeeper left AND a 3inch 'Palmetto Bug' found crawling about the floor on day 3 didn't make me happy. The mattresses are also so soft that my husband and I woke up with horribly sore necks and backs everyday!!! Breakfast was actually quite impressive. Not just your typical continental but get up early. There must have been a special on group rates last week because we had the Girl Scouts, then a few others honing in on our previously quiet space. I did enjoy the courtyard and relaxing fountain. Pool was ok but definitely needs a really good cleaning. If I had even seen a skimmer I would have been happy to help! Location is good. Trolley is literally right out front and Voodoo BBQ is right down the street - yummy! All in all, for $79/89 night week/weekend rate I shouldn't complain. Not the best but certainly not the worst I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Loriekirk
Reviews.Content: This was a great location across the street from the St Charles street car. The room was clean enough. The bathroom could have used a good scrub. The price was good. The parking was 17.00 per night. The breakfast was good with cereals, yogurt and waffles. The pool could have used a good scrub. All in all it was a good value and I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: kcncporter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and have no complaints. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, and the property is very charming. I loved the courtyards and the old buildings. Breakfast was the normal stuff (donuts, bagels, toast, cereal). They did have omelet type eggs with cheese inside and sausage links and both of them were good. We loved having the trolley stop right outside of the hotel and hardly used our car at all while we were there. Make sure you go to Cafe DuMonde for beignets!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value option in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Copperdesk63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times for JazzFest and it is a good option. Close to everything not just in the quarter but in other neighborhoods and a convenient place to get to the fairgrounds. The price is also right which is its best point.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Willow78717
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel for our stay in New Orleans, we came upon the Suites Maison website and thought that it would be a great hotel. We saw many recommendations for this hotel. I don't know exactly where they stayed, but the suite that we were given was horrible. The smell was bad - I had problems with my allergies being in the room just a few minutes. The room looked shabby and not at all like the photos we saw. There was no elevator and we had to haul our luggage two flights of stairs. We were there for Jazzf Fest and could not stay at that hotel. For $220.00 you would think you would at least get a decent room. We checked out of that hotel as quickly as we could, but were left with no room in New Orleans in the middle of Jazz Fest. After we searched around for another hotel, we found a much better, upscale hoted that was clean and right in the French Quarter for less money. We were lucky! To say the least stay away for this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Nice”
Reviews.Author: jfk_jfuller
Reviews.Content: Loved staying there. It was beautiful, comfortable, and everyone was nice. The trolley is right on the other side of the street. Didn't need to drive or take cab to go to the touristy places. The breakfast is a little better then most continental breakfasts. With AAA did not have to pay the parking fee. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the stay and park cruise package.”
Reviews.Author: Tonya4052
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 15 & 16th with the park and cruise package they offer. We had 5 rooms total and everyone was happy with the hotel. They had lots of security so we felt safe even though some of the building around the hotel did not look so great. Lots of places to eat around the hotel or the street car across the street was easy to use to get to the other areas. They offered a simple breakfast but be there early or you might miss out. Staff was friendly check in and check out was a breeze price was just as we was told it would be. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At Maison St. Charles!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilb123
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the hotel this past weekend. Went down to New Orleans with a group of friends. Nobody in the group had one complaint about the hotel. The breakfast was great. The location is convenient to everything. The streetcar stops right outside the hotel. The hotel staff were very accomodating and friendly. There was security on the premises which made you feel perfectly safe the whole time.This was my first trip to New Orleans and it definitely won't be my last. And when I go back, Maison St. Charles will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Checked In, Checked Out”
Reviews.Author: vacationhappy_11
Reviews.Content: It was my understanding that this hotel was recently renovated. Well, I checked in and checked out 10 minutes later. The room that I was assigned was on the first floor and was damp and moldy - thick mold in the shower. I just couldn't do it...it was nasty. The hotel is also located next to a fast food place and the area in the courtyard smelled like fried food - no way to escape it. The good news is the woman at the front desk was awesome - pure southern hospitality. I was refunded all monies.

Reviews.Title: “I should have known better”
Reviews.Author: Fiche
Reviews.Content: My husband and a friend of ours stayed here for three nights during a trip down south that included the New years Holiday. We've stayed in New Orleans many times and have our favorite Inn to stay in, but poor planning and odd circumstances of our own fault left us without a reservation a week before NYE. First the positives: -If you'd like to be within walking distance of the streetcar stop, the CBD and the French Quarter then this is a good spot for you. -This is a very basic remodeled chain hotel. The renovations are tasteful for the most part. -The staff was really nice given the crap that happened to us (see below) Negatives-- -its just a remodeled chain hotel. Nothing fancy and no character -If you prefer to be in a neighborhood, in a property with New Orleans charm, this is NOT the place for you -The Hotel has many signs up stating that it is a nonsmoking hotel. This is important to me. Well, we check into our room and not only does it REEK of smoke, but there is actual cigarette ash on the A/C unit. I don't even want to know. The room we were given was a corner ground floor property, my husband theorized that its the staff goof-off room or whatever. ...leading me to the next point... -The first night that we were there in that room, we came home on the later side (who doesn't?) and none of our key cards would work. We tried everything. I went to the front desk multiple times until the desk attendant called an "on call" janitor to come look at the door. We waited fifteen minutes for the janitor to get there from his home (not blaming him) to get let into our room. -With a broken door and a room reeking of cigarettes, I demanded a room change in the morning. I was moved with no argument (but no apology either) to a clean, quiet room with a working door the next morning. The management should have been alerted of the problem, and we should have been offered an apology or some gesture to restore our confidence. I understand that its a busy holiday, and hotels have no problems filling up rooms, but guests still need to be treated well. By the time we left, all I wanted to do was be at the 1896O'Malley House. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with great service!”
Reviews.Author: adw812
Reviews.Content: My friends and I couldn't have picked a better hotel! The rooms were nice and clean! It is an older hotel but has been very well maintained. The landscaping is beautiful and if you don't want to venture out, you can lounge around at the tables that are located in shaded area of the hotel. We were there to have fun for Mardi Gras and was surprised that the hotel is located on the route of some of the parades. The streetcar runs right in front of the hotel and the buses run that route as well. Once our vehicle was parked it didn't move. The front desk staff was very friendly. Thank you Natasha and Troy you all made our stay enjoyable. When we asked for more towels, we received them in less than 10 minutes. Great hotel! No complaints! Great choice for location, price and conveinence! We will definitely stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “What a Blast”
Reviews.Author: saintdisney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so much fun!! The rooms were large and very clean. The pillows and bed were so comfortable I didn't want to get up in the morning. I was very impressed with the free breakfast. Usually all you get is toast and cereal. There was eggs, sausage. waffles and just about everything else. Mardi Gras was going on and yes it was loud. Everyone was having a blast morning noon and night. The courtyard was so nice to have gatherings at breakfast or for coctails. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service helps you overlook the little things..”
Reviews.Author: Girthman
Reviews.Content: Hotel was better than expected considering it's 3 star rating. The rooms were clean, we requested extra towels the first day and staff brought them right away. The different building styles and brick pathways give it an "Old Village" feel. The patios are lanscaped nicely. The continental breakfast is adequate as much as any continental breakfast would be. If you're looking white linens and crystal this ain't it. The staff at the front desk were awsome! Very helpful with everything we needed. Directions, resturant suggestons, etc. You can walk out of the front door and step right onto the St Charles street trolley. If you are planing on spending most of your time in the French Quarter this would be quite a hike without the trolley. If you are planning on spending time in the Garden District this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Let's be Real”
Reviews.Author: MissL91
Reviews.Content: Okay, yes I agree with the other reviews that the rooms are very pretty. I was very impressed when we arrived, and we were able to get a lot of nice pictures in the court yard. We stayed in a basic room not a suite that had a wall mounted tv with EVERY channel fussy, and some of them didn't have volume which ws very dissapointing. The tv went in and out of signal at times. The room was very clean when we first arrived, and it seemed like the housekeeping was very lacking the rest of our stay. My spouse and I are clean people and would expect the floor to be vacuumed daily which it was not. There is a refrigerator with no microwave so don't expect to bring anything back here and heat it up. There is an iron/board which the iron we had was spitting water all over our clothing and wasn't ironing well. Our shower head had a problem spewing water all over which the matienece did fix promptly. We went out one day and came back around 3pm and our room still wasn't clean! We were told the housekeepers were in a mandatory meeting so NOBODY was cleaning! This happened twice in the same week! How can you have everyone in a mandatory meeting at the same time? We recieved towels one night and no washcloths so we called and were told all they had were towels, then five mintues later they magically had two washcloths. It is located ideal if you are taking the streetcar because you can walk right out to it. Internet is complimentary, and there is an outdoor pool and a small jucuzzi. I would not stay here again after seeing other hotels. My spouse and I were very upset with the service, and housekeeping. Stay somewhere else unless you are only here to sleep and do nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jzpd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here once before. The pictures of the room don't do them justice. The purple rooms were cozy with well decorated bathrooms. We even looked at a suite and were impressed too. The staff is helpful and offer good service. Both times we stayed we were more than happy with our visits. They had one of our favorite continental breakfasts accompanied by a pleasant dining atmosphere. The location is on St. Charles Ave within a short distance of several attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Little "Down at the Heels"”
Reviews.Author: BusyBee
Reviews.Content: Given that the hotel probably took a beating during Katrina, it's tempting to overlook its many flaws. Charm it has, along with a good location and friendly front desk staff. However, it needs to be stripped to the walls and re-worked in almost every way. Safe door would not close, let alone lock. We had to move rooms because the heater/air conditioner was rattling too loudly to sleep, but our second room was almost as bad. Carpeting was worn, door jambs were dirty, bath facilities had definitely seen better days. The floors in the breakfast room looked like they could use a good power washing. We had planned to stay for two nights, but when the weather turned nasty, we elected to drive on, leaving this hotel with no regrets. We currently are planning a family trip (6 rooms) to New Orleans in June, and this hotel would have been a logical choice for us, but we shall look elsewhere. I'm willing to pay more for a better standard of cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “loved it....great location”
Reviews.Author: marianng
Reviews.Content: very nice...all amenities...biggest draw was trolley right in front of the building...that went every where ,,except the port and we got a cab for that...making getting around very cheap. price was right for us..through expedia

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: gabby1girl
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. It was clean, conveniently located, landscaping was fabulous and the complimentary breakfast was all that was promised and much more. We enjoyed our stay The price was reasonable and the surroundings offered us the "New Orleans experience" without the outrageous price. We will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, "Cock Roaches"”
Reviews.Author: stsytuis
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were not given the room that I had reserved on-line. I called twice before our arrival to confirm our choice. I was promised a certain room. We checked in and realized that we didn't have the right room, we were moved but not without some attitude from the front desk. The manager acted like she was doing me a favor by honoring our room rate. This hotel, is I supposedly located in the Garden District, but not really. It's right next to a very shady looking daquirri shop, our first day there was a guy outside the place threatening to kill somebody. We love New Orleans and have been many time, this was the first time we hadn't stayed in the Quarter and we won't make this mistake again. When I brought the roaches to the attention of the front desk, she gave us 18.00 off the price of our bill. Pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Sedlak7195
Reviews.Content: The motel was $53/night plus $17/day to park your car. You will pay parking for every motel in NO. Parking is next to impossiblein the city. Take the trolley. We went at xmas and we sang xmas songs. Rooms small but clean. You could walk to the french qtr... 25 min. Will stay here again. Do not go to Pascal manales restuarant... ripoff

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: spiewaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the main road, which makes it very easy to catch a street car. There is a computer in the lobby for all guests to use. It's free of charge. The rooms are not bad: slightly dated but rather clean. I must mention, though, that if you are very sensitive to smells, there was a certain smell in our room which took some getting used to every time we walked inside. The staff was friendly. Not a bad choice but there are better choices out there for similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: KSkouple
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and welcoming upon arrival. Our room was off a charming courtyard. Decor was a fun New Orleans-style. The complimentary breakfast each morning was nice, plenty of choices. Having the street car stop in front of the hotel made transportation easy. Another plus was the computer & printer in the lobby. Last, but definitely not least, we got it all at a fabulous "Special Rates" price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect luxury at this price but it's clean, safe, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: dcm9
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay with my son who was in town for a conference. The room had two queen beds, was clean and comfortable and was adequate for our needs. Our room looked out on a nice little courtyard, room 212, and we could hear the water from the fountain. On the down side, the cooked breakfast items weren't very good and they lock the doors to the eating area as soon as b'fast is over so there's no way to get a cup of coffee or refill your water bottle later in the day. I suspect they do this for safety. The location was excellent for travel into the French Quarter or to the Garden District. The streetcar line runs right outside the hotel and there is a Wendy's restaurant next door. Don't expect luxury at this price but it's clean, safe, and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good...room location terrible”
Reviews.Author: Louisianamrs
Reviews.Content: Ok now this hotel is nice...a little bit of a parking issue but nothing that wasn't fixed quickly...and it's really located in an area with plenty of restaurants...only thing is I don't appreciate the location of the room we were in...near the stairs, elevator, ice machine, and maid supply room...horrible noises...also the elevator door doesn't close all the way...I was going to mention all to the fringe desk, but my husband didn't want to deal with moving everything, but I feel as though they knew these were issues when they placed us in this room and just didn't care...no way they haven't had complaints before

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel does not look as good as the pictures.”
Reviews.Author: TexanXXL
Reviews.Content: I was excited about this hotel due to the high rateings but noticed that several people comment on the condition of the hotel and there dissappointment with the property. When I arrived I asked to be shown the property and my room prior to checking in. The are of the hotel is in the a nice area but the pictures look better then the rooms. When I inspected my room the paint was peeling in the bathroom and on my way down stairs I noticed that the hand rails were not very secure. I moved to a Marriott down town and enjoyed my stay there. The front desk clerk was nice enough to cancel my room but wanted to say I agree that this may not be as good as the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to need some work & staff not overly helpful”
Reviews.Author: ScottWChapelHill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this motel twice--most recently for 3 nights during Tulane parent weekend. We arrived early and were told along with other guests there was no way to check-in, but we could leave our luggage and check back around 3 for a room. Most motels will reserve a room for you, and give you the key after it is cleaned. The room we had was quiet, but is starting to show wear. The shower head needed to be replaced. The room had a mild odor (unlike the room of our first visit) and the air conditioner did not seem to work properly. There was no bed spread on the bed and we were told that is normal. The breakfast is poorly run and as another reviewer noted, not well-stocked. As compared with other hotels I have stayed at, the breakfast is poorly run. We finally went to a restaurant the final morning, and if we stay there again, will avoid the breakfast. Our room was relatively quiet, so the night's sleep was good. The area is not the best and is a long walk to the Quarter, and too far to walk to Tulane. The streetcar is located out front, so transportation is not a huge issue. In summary--the motel is adequate and I will stay there again if other motels are not available. Hopefully, the owners will make sure the motel does not fall further into disrepair (another longer time guest told me she has seen the motel also decline in quality).

Reviews.Title: “We will stay somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: kherb43
Reviews.Content: We were visiting for Tulane's Family weekend. Location is okay for Tulane visitors. Other than that, it is just a mediocre motel. We were in an end room and did not feel very safe since the location is in a more sketchy area. Saw a couple of homeless people hanging around. The parking lot where you park to check in is shared with a Wendy's. You then have to park across a street and pay $17 just for the privilege. When we went down for breakfast, just about everything was gone except for bagels and toast, and this was an hour before breakfast ends. We just did not have a safe and comfortable feeling staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Full of flavor!”
Reviews.Author: rexpopp
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get #145, one of the oldest bulidings...500 years old. We had our own porch where we sat amongst the lush landscaping. The staff made our stay very enjoyable! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: malicetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this charming hotel. Very clean and well kept, the staff was nice and the room was lovely. We loved the ambience - the courtyard was great for sitting out in the evening with a bottle of wine. Being able to hop on the trolley to get around was fantastic. $5 will get you an all-day pass, and we went to the zoo (there is a shuttle that will take you from the trolley to the zoo, or you can enjoy a lovely walk thru the park) and also to the French Quarter. We had sushi at a great place just a few doors down. We'll definately be going back here!

Reviews.Title: “charming & convenient to Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ghburch
Reviews.Content: Cute, charming, clean & safe! Quick decision to stay one night. Front desk helpful with directions and suggestion for place to eat! Street car stop right across street - takes you straight to heart of French Quarter. No hastle parking. Didn't do breakfast here - opted for Cafe du Monde.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NOLA, but falls short in quality”
Reviews.Author: klipspringer
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable. The shower did not work well, and even though the problems were reported to the hotel staff, they weren't fixed. The internet was extremely slow at best, and often did not work. During the 3 days I was there I noticed trash on the stairwell that never got picked up. The staff was not overly friendly. The complimentary breakfast was poor. In a city famous for food it was a let down to have a"plastic" breakfast the likes of what could be found at any roadside motel along the interstate anywhere in the country: blah food with no imagination. Could have done better at a gas station! But, it is a fair value for New Orleans, it is in a convenient location, and it is quiet. I would recommend the hotel - with understanding of its short falls - only if traveling on a budget. Otherwise, this city has so much better to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Amenities--Location--Price--Accomodations--Has It All”
Reviews.Author: willyd21
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with a little negative part of our stay. On the first day, I found a half-dead cockroach on his back behind the toilet and a slug crawling on the bathtub. I promptly gave both a burial at sea in the toilet before my wife saw either of them.(She would have freaked out). This was the only bad thing for our entire stay--some might consider this disgusting and give a negative review--but I don't think it was a case of uncleanliness or neglect--just an un-avoidable part of the area where there is extreme dampness and humidity. OK, now the good stuff. We stayed in a queen bed suite that had all the amenities we could ask for--coffee maker, hair dryer, heat lamp in bath/shower area, ironing board & iron, microwave, safe, 2 LCD TV's (one in bedroom area and one in living room area.) It was a combination of French and Early American furnishings, just like New Orleans is. Sofa bed in living room area as well as a chair, coffee table and desk. Looked like the rooms may have been from 17th or 18th century--very nostalgic--15 foot ceilings--8 foot doors--fireplaces (Non-functioning) in bedroom and living room--tasteful paintings on most walls. All in all, a great New Orleans experience--staff was friendly and courteous (especially security man Tony)--pointing out all the things a first-time visitor should do. Continental breakfast was more than "continental"--serving eggs, sausage, toast, pastries, cereal, juices, etc. The location is perfect--far enough from the noise of the French Quarter to get a good night's sleep--but close enough to take a short trolley ride (Trolley stops right in front of the hotel) to the French Market, Harrah's Casino, French Quarter, etc. Hotel also has beautiful courtyards in three locations and a good-sized pool and a jacuzzi. Wonderful first-time New Orleans experience. We also got our suite for a very good price ($59.00 per night w/free parking and free wi/fi) through a deal with Travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was recommended as a good...”
Reviews.Author: BAFMOM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended as a good value in a good location but it was the worst place I have stayed in a very long time. When we arrived at 4:45 yesterday, the room wasn't ready. The clerk who started to check us in vanished at 5. The second clerk refused to let us into the room to change our traveling clothes until the room was ready. It wasnt ready until after 6 so we had to forfeit our 5:45 dinner reservation at Stella and the restaurant was fully booked for the rest of the evening. When we finally checked into our 2 BR "suite," we found 1 bath towel in the master BR, dirty floors, and cigarette stained drapes. The door key only worked in the door into my son's bedroom, not the door into the living room. In the morning, the hairdryer melted when I used in on high (no kidding!!). The shower faucet in the 2nd bathroom drips. When we came back to the room at 2 p.m., the room hadn't been made up, & still wasn't made up when we returned again at 9. When I called the front desk I was told that there was nothing the clerk could do because housekeeping went home at 5. (whether the job was done or not, apparently). We did get a couple of towels from security, but when I demanded an adjustment to the bill, the clerk said I'd have to talk to the manager who won't be I'm until 3 tomorrow. Poor room and pitiful service for $160/night + $17 parking. Unfortunately, we're stuck here one more night, but I would never return, would definitely NOT recommend it and doubt I'll give my business or my company's business to this or any other Clarion Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal, and charming little spot”
Reviews.Author: Camsyn
Reviews.Content: I looked around online for days to find a reasonable, yet safe and good rated hotel in NOLA, and this was a good pick. It's not in the French Quarter, or the Garden District, but right in between the two. The street car runs right in front of the hotel's somewhat hard to find street facade, so you can get to either pretty easily. Buy a pass for $5 /day and you are good to go. Rooms were warn a bit, but clean, cool, and safe. Charming little cluster of buildings make up the hotel, and the courtyard connectes everything. We paid $71 for weekend nights, but add in the tax and parking (who pays for parking?- you do in NOLA) it came up to about $200, not bad. The pool is small, and full of kids, but still ok. The breakfast is pretty nice. If I like NOLA better, I would stay again, but turns out I'm not too fond of it. It was so hot and humid, and stinky when we visited, I doubt I'll hurry back. There are some really good places to eat close by, and don't miss Madelein's bakery and coffee in the uptown district- past the garden district at the street car turn on St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: trarecar
Reviews.Content: I hate to give a bad review, but I feel like I must. A duvet cover in our room had a blood stain on it when we got there, hidden on the underside. The next morning I left the covers with the blood stain face up so that they would replace it - well, guess what. They put it BACK on the bed. Disgusting! Once management came, it took hours for us to get a replacement. Candy that we did not eat was left on the carpet. We stayed three nights, and the pool was not cleaned ONCE, inside or out. A set of used bandaids stayed on the side of the pool the entire time, and the pool stayed full of dirt. I checked on those bandaids every day in hopes that they would be picked up. They weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: George1218
Reviews.Content: My two teenage boys and I spent 6 nights during the last week in June and 1st week in July at Maison St. Charles and we were extremely delighted with our stay! The hotel staff was very helpful and nice; the two best restaurants we visited were recommended by them! The staff was very helpful in recommending places to visit. We had a great time taking the street cars (you can pretty much take them to within short walking distance to anything in Garden District or French quarter). When I fell and hurt my leg (not at the hotel) they were wonderful and called taxis for me. The beds were extremely comfortable. The next time we go back to New Orleans we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoLaneBlacktop
Reviews.Content: I was staying two nights in this hotel with my girlfriend. The room was really nice, with everything you can basically ask for. The staff weren't really nice, but we didn't really need them, so it didn't bother us. If you come with a car, you will be asked to pay 17$ extra per day to park in a secured parking lot, or park in the street. The location is pretty good - ten minute walking from the French Quarter. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont mind a short walk, this place is great”
Reviews.Author: lily0509
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really clean and absolutely beautiful. I would highly reccomend it to anyone. It is a little out of the way from the loud and craziness of the city, but the street car stop right in front of the hotel so its a 5 minute street car ride to Canal st and Bourbon St. We walked a lot and it took us about 15 minutes walking. The hotel itself is really clean, the rooms are air conditioned and very neat. I found the hotel to have a lot of ammenities such as breakfast and a pool. Over all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was the best for information on where to go and what to see”
Reviews.Author: shari_amery
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tony Goodo and his staff, we had the absolute best time! He was so helpful about guiding us to tours and use of the local trolley system, which was the best money we spent. The location on St Charles Avenue was great....close to restaurants....it was great to take the trolley from St Charles and then connect to the Canal Street trolley and be able to walk to other points of interest. The staff was friendly and couldn't have been more helpful, right down to a computer in the lobby so we could check in and print our boarding passes for the trip home. Breakfast was a reasonable selection of hot and cold choices.......the pool was small but nice. Tony told us about some of the ghost sitings right on the premises, which was fun......

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay- check prices first....”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper19-20
Reviews.Content: Our trip was planned thru our local AAA and we were given a $79 rate for our visit. The $17 nightly auto parking was a strain for four nights.(someone wrote they had parking included????) The site was very clean and spacious and our room was nice and comfortable. It was pleasant compared to other reviews listed here. The breakfast was very nice but was abruptly dismantled at precisely 9:30am. Staff was mostly friendly and accessible. While at breakfast I talked with folks and learned that they had the $59 and $67 nightly rates and when I inquired at desk I was told that was their AAA rate ($79) for me- to no avail. I will stay here again but I will call and get their (Hotel rate) before I book with AAA. If you are to stay here a few days buy the transit pass for streetcar from the desk or go across the street to the bank and buy one before your very first ride. $ 1.25 per direction $2.50 R/T get pass and save. This is a nice area but a little removed from from attractions in both directions so travel of some form will be required. The streetcars seem to run erratically and after evening hours they run every 30 minutes (30-45mins) to every hour after late evening. Don't get tanked up on Bourbon St. and hope to get back swiftly after 11pm because you will wait forever on the street corner at Canal and Carondelet St.for a streetcar. There are some good resturants on St. Charles St. and ride the car over to the Carrolltown area for some nice cafes and the Park. All in all I would recommend this location and I would use it again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills - Listen to TripAdvisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: taxmom53
Reviews.Content: Once again, the reviews on TripAdvisor were right on the money in rating this hotel. It was a good value for the money if you're satisfied with a relatively clean, no frills hotel and don't mind some inconveniences. We stayed in a king suite in the breakfast room building that was clean and quite large but whose furnishings were tired and in some cases broken (bureau drawer pull, ripped upholstery, dirty sofa cushions). The parking price was moderate compared to the French Quarter and there was easy access to our car. MSC is located just outside downtown and is right on the streetcar line so its quite convenient to the Uptown, the Garden District, the universities, French Quarter, etc. The bathroom was clean with a shower that drained well and had moderate force. The a/c was good and the breakfast was fine with plenty of typical breakfast items - nothing fancy. However, the housekeeping service was only average because the beds were made and the bathroom cleaned but there was no vacuming in the 4 nights we stayed; we asked 4 times for a top sheet for the sofa bed and never received one but got extra towels instead and the refrig was not defrosted so it leaked. Check-in was slow because there was only one person on staff (who kept her cool in spite of being overwhelmed). The WIFI didn't work immediately and was spotty at times. Finally, there was no check-out option on the TV which often had poor reception and the channel guide card on the table was inaccurate-channels didn't match the card! Most of these drawbacks were already mentioned in previous TripAdvisor reviews so believe what you read here. If you are looking for a no frills place to stay with low prices and average services the MSC will be fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good rate, good stay.”
Reviews.Author: thekeithmeister
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, New Orleans style architecture feels authentic. Friendly staff. Decent continental breakfast with some "hot" items (sausage and eggs). Convenient location not in the French Quarter but close by and right by the St. Charles St. trolley to take you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, problem with credit card, wanted to charge more”
Reviews.Author: melissablumenfeld
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel. I booked it for my daughter who was traveling alone. They were supposed to send me a credit card authorization form, but first had a problem with their phones, then said they emailed but I never received it, and then wouldn't email or fax it to me because the manager was not in the office. My daughter arrived at the hotel at midnight from a late flight in. They made me try to access Travelocity and Expedia to rebook the room. After and hour on the phone with them, from Israel, they finally fixed the website where I could book online, but I was no longer getting the $59 room that I had reserved, they said it was not longer there and I needed to pay them $100. I had a confirmation number and email from them saying I had the room. At 1:30am, I had to send my daughter in a taxi to another hotel that kindly made an appropriate reservation for her and let her up to the room to sleep while we faxed information back and forth. (Try booking at the Quality Inn and Suites on O'Keefe, they are very professional.) I think I will also have to get my bank involved so they can have the charge refunded. Go somewhere else, quick!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been very good, EXCEPT...”
Reviews.Author: PiinVa
Reviews.Content: The position is not bad, it's on the st charles streetcar line which goes to the french quarter and bourbon street..but at night you may have to wait for the streetcar for 30-45 minutes, and the hotel is not really at walking distance (25 minutes).. so you're dependent on transportation. The hotel is made of different buildings, some newer some older, there's a little swimming pool with jacuzzi outside and it looks nice. Staff was nice and there's a computer with printer available in the lobby. Also free wifi all over the place. The room was all right, quiet, with safe, but i soon realised the carpet hadn't probably seen a vacuum cleaner in ages. some hair in the bathroom and linen. But it was not too bad until I witnessed the cleaning of the room. A girl came with new sheets and towels, an old broom and that was it. She kind of rinsed the sink, changed sheets and towels, and in 3 minutes she was out. Now i'm not a picky person, but that is not acceptable, especially in an old building with carpets all over the place. I have also seen that in the newer buildings the personnel was much better equipped, so I don't know how it works. Breakfast was edible. For the price (60/night for a king), it would have been a good review, if it wasn't for the cleanliness. To sum up, if you're on a tight budget and have loose hygiene standards, go for it. Otherwise, look around.

Reviews.Title: “charming and comfortable at a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: glazener
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed one night while visiting college campuses in New Orleans. Maison St. Charles was charming, very clean, easy in & out, on St. Charles St., incredible price with AAA discount. The room was spacious - beds were so comfortable and plush! - attractive bath area, in room frig & microwave. Breakfast was easy and plentiful. Felt safe, parking is worth the fee. Desk staff was pleasant and helpful. Used Internet access in the lobby with no problem. I'd defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: HoustonJen
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Maison St. Charles can't be beat. Sure, it's not the Ritz, but for $71 (base rate), I am thrilled when a room is clean. Maison St. Charles takes it one step further with cute courtyards, festive Mardi Gras inspired room decor and a large bathroom vanity. Location provided great access to the trolly and is directly across the street from Emril's Delmonico Restaurant. (and plenty of taxi service). Cons: weak wifi signal, well worn rooms (but clean and not unbearable), uncomfortable bed Pros: at least $30 cheaper than neighboring hotels of similar caliber

Reviews.Title: “A very average experience in a glorified motel”
Reviews.Author: IJFK
Reviews.Content: I was not particularly impressed by this hotel. I arrived late, around 11pm, only to be put in a room that smelled bad (smoke) and had teenagers next to me constantly slam the doors. Staff was nice though, and I was put into another room shortly and without issues. The room was very average, though clean and spacious. I was not impressed by the bathroom and shower, bed was comfortable though. All rooms have noisy window units that, due to it being New Orleans, are constantly on at full blast pretty much. The breakfast was not impressive, but I'd have to admit that I am picky eater. Still, how people can state that this "hotel" offers a good breakfast is beyond me. You're much better off getting breakfast at the Blue Plate, one block east across the tracks. The hotel is supposed to have wifi, but I was never able to get on for more than 15 minutes, it was very spotty and unreliably. In the end I just used my wwan card. My stay wasn't bad by any means, but still below average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on the Trolley LIne”
Reviews.Author: Looooove_2_travel
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a reasonably priced hotel room in New Orleans but didn't want to pay $150 for a room, when I came across a great deal for this hotel on travelzoo.com. The price was $55/night including parking. The hotel is on the St. Charles Trolley line, and is about a 15 minute ride from the French Quarter. I had no problems getting a car in the morning, but a return in the evening at 5:30 pm was quite difficult. I had to wait for about 45 minutes. The hotel itself appears to be a series of multiple building, which appear to be fairly new, and an older building in the center. I stayed in the older building on the 3rd floor. I'm assuming this was because of the discounted rate, but it might have been a coincindence. The room reminded me of European B&B's - Quite elegant with a King size bed, chandelier, small bathroom, and large flatscreen TV, and Queen Anne chair. The ceiling was sloped (since I was on the top floor) and there were 2 small picture windows. The Air conditioning worked very well, which is important in New Orleans. The room was very quiet On the down side, the room was starting to show its age - The white paint on the doorways could use a good cleaning. The stairway leading to the room also showed its age in the form of steps that weren't level - typical of older houses. The continental breakfast in the morning was much better than I anticipated. In addition to the standard cereal, fruit & breaks, they has sausage links and 2 types of pre-cooked eggs. The parking was also adequate. There were about 8 spots "on-site", and an additional 30-40 spots across the street in a private lot. I've stayed in much nicer notels around the world, but I'm giving this one a good rating because of the incredible value for the hotel. Once again I stayed in the "old house", so i don't know what the experience was like in the "traditional hotel" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “You will fall in love with this hotel and its staff!”
Reviews.Author: supermomgreenville
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans and this hotel really represented its city well. The hotel was so pretty and charming. The staff was so hospitable and helpful. The location is perfect!! We had the time of our lives. We plan to return to New Orleans again and again, and as far as I am concerned the Maison St. Charles Inn and Suites is the only hotel I will stay with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: courtaz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Maison St Charles and it exceeded my expectations. I was able to book through one of the travel sites and because of the low price I fully expected to walk into a disaster. This place is great. Location: Easy access to Bourbon St and the Riverwalk. We were able to purchase our cable car passes from the front desk. Because of the location the tour companies will pick you up at the front door. I will make note there is a daiquiri bar one block over and at night there is a gathering on the corner but no one was rude or made you feel uncomfortable. Staff: This is what customer service is all about. Solecia and Tasha were very helpful. Thank you ladies for your patience with my many questions! Room: Again I was very surprised. Spacious room, vanity outside the bathroom (great when multiple people are trying to get ready), fridge in the room, and a room safe. The bathroom did have wear and tear but it was NOT dirty. Food: There are fast food places within walking distance. I would suggest you walk 3 blocks down to the local tavern - St Charles Tavern. Great food (Bleu burger) and you expect "Norm" to walk in at any moment. Overall: I would recommend this place to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm!”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle74
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very French feel especially the main entrance hall. It is unusual in the sense that the accommodation is separate from hotel itself just off the courtyard each room with their own front door in a three storey high building, the rooms are big, bed is very comfortable, however the bathroom is quaint. I had a problem with the hot water in the shower for the first 2 night and rang reception 3-4 times to see if someone could take a look at it and they promised to send someone from maintenance over, but nobody arrived, one of the receptionist on the night shift that I happened to ring was very apologetic and had it fixed in 10 mins and rang the roome to make sure everything was ok. The hotel itself is near the Garden District and right across the street from the streetcar. It is out of the hussle and buzz of town. It is a 20-25min walk from the convention centre. The hotel is a little isolated I felt from things but is great for families. I didn't eat in any of the nearby restaurants, overall it is a nice clean hotel, my only fault was the fact it took 2 days to send over someone to fix my shower which given the price of the rooms is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “location is great and staff is simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: CSCOORDINATOR
Reviews.Content: As a employee with Choice Hotels, I have to say I'm probably one of the most picky travelers to encounter. I don't expect anything over the normal, but I tend to notice things others might not and I'm especially hard on the staff, since I have expectations for them based on my own staff. The Quality Inn Maison St. Charles did not disappoint. We arrived early the morning of our check in, around 4am. We called ahead to make sure that it was ok to check in and the girl was very nice, informing us that they did have a room available but it would be another days charge, which I expected. The front desk night girl was very nice and friendly (which third shift people often lack) but it was the security guard, John, who made my stay excellent. The parking for this hotel is across the street, but John let us park and unload before we parked across the street. He was very helpful on both nights that we saw him. One of the other guys on staff, I didn't catch his name, was also very helpful when we came down one afternoon. The hotel lobby is beautiful, the courtyard is nice, and the rooms are nice. The balconies, ice machines, and elevators weren't as clean as I would have liked though. The rooms were nice, but could use a little remodeling. There was a weird bath mat in our shower, which seemed to have been glued to the bottom of the tub. It was old and worn out. The menus in the directory were a little out of date as well. We didn't get housekeeping while we stayed, but they did get us extra towels and took our trash out that we left on the porch, which was great. This was our first time to New Orleans. We were originally going to stay at the Clarion Grand Boutique down the road, and we are glad that we didn't. We went into that hotel, and while it looked nicer, the staff was rude and unfriendly. In all, I would recommend this hotel. The location is great and the staff is simply amazing. We had a wonderful time and when we return, we look forward to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: dancingtrip
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the Garden Dist. By using the street car, you can go most of the interest points. Walking to WWII museum is only 10 min. Room is clean. Breakfast is good. We're glad we booked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChattaDale
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Maison St. Charles and we've booked a third for a family gathering in May. Our first stay was in the Mardi Gras Suite in May 2009; the latest stay was in a double queen room, April 2010. The rooms have always been clean and updated; any problems were dealt with promptly and to our satisfaction. Keep in mind that a few of the suites and rooms are in historic buildings and furnished with antiques which may not be to everyone's likeing, but we think it adds to the whole NOLA experience. Rooms in the non-historic buildings have all been updated nicely. Bedding was always clean and very, very comfortable. In-room coffee is delicious and the continental breakfast is appealing and served in the comfortable pool house. Parking is on-site which is a real convenience as you can get to your vehicle any time you want. Most hotels in the French Quarter area have valet-only parking and can take 30 minutes or more to have your car brought around. The landscaping is beautiful and the many courtyards with fountains make for great "Kodak moments". Location is right on the street car line that you can catch to go uptown to Audubon park, the zoo, Camilia Grill (a NOLA classic), or just ride and admire the architecture of the Garden District. Take it downtown to hit the French Quarter, the French Market, Jackson Square, the Aquarium, and all the wonderful little shops on Royal and every other side street. I can't say enough good things about the staff. The manager, desk clerks, guards, housekeeping staff, the breakfast lady and everyone else who works here have all been so kind and helpful to us. They all work hard to make your stay outstanding. When you stay here, please take the time to get to know some of these people. Many of them lived through Katrina and have quite a story to tell. A lot can be learned about life in New Orleans by talking with them. This will be our first choice for any future stays and we recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: redbett
