Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the Maison St. Charles, Sunday night prior to our cruise and Saturday night upon our return. All of the staff were very helpful and very friendly. They were very personable and ready to please. The rooms are very nicely done in the New Orleans fashion, the bedding was wonderful and very comfortable! They have a lovely courtyard area, pool and breakfast every morning offered a very good selection to fit everyone's dietary needs. The hotel is centrally located between the garden district and the french quarters. We were only footsteps away to 2 street car stops. what a great way to see the city. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, good breakfast, inconsistent maid service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eacuf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a group that was in town for a wedding. The staff, for the most part was very helpful and friendly. The location was within walking distance of the garden district and the french quarter (although a bit of a hike) and on the street car route for people that would rather ride. Also a very easy ride from the airport. The rooms were nice, but the maid service was spotty. Towels, toilet paper, etc, were not always replenished. Our rug had sticky spots on it and was in need of a cleaning. There were a couple of courtyards with tables for late night gatherings. I would return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and quirky. Perfect location to sight-see, and party.”
Reviews.Author: redgirl24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very unique. Looks like a plain brick building from the front, but designed in the typical New Orleans courtyard fashion. I was with a group of four females and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was great and any time we needed something, they were there within a couple of minutes. Great breakfast. Did get noisy with guests at night, but hey, this is New Orleans. Wished it would have been warmer to enjoy the pool and hot tub, but maybe next time I will get the chance. The beds were very comfy and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel in a perfect position for parade season”
Reviews.Author: voyagerSussex
Reviews.Content: With a range of low-rise buildings this doesn't feel like a typical hotel but the slightly quirky layout is a plus. Walking outside for the nightly parades, jumping the streetcar downtown, walking the mile to the French Quarter all added to the crazy 'Who Dat' atmosphere of New Orleans. Service was efficient and helpful and the busy breakfast room was always well stocked. With the run up to Mardi Gras you have to expect a little noise!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dannjackie04
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located. Nice staff. The room looked nice when we opened the door. HOWEVER- White comforter was very dirty. When we sat on the bed, it was like sinking in a hole. I either slept right on top of my husband or almost off the bed the whole night. It got hot in the room so my husband turned on A/C which rattled so loud we had to turn it off. As far as sleep, don't expect any. There were people outside in the courtyard yelling all night long. And, doors slammed constantly. We finally decided to try to leave the tv turned on to drown out the partying outside. I also had to warn my small children (on 3 different occasions) not to step on or touch the dirty panties that were laying on the stairs. I would ABSOLOUTLY NOT reccomend this hotel to anyone, especially if you have small children. I figured for $190 a night, it would be nice. No such luck.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: seans11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with a couple of friends stayed in a two room suite right above the check in desk. It was a one night stay and we really enjoyed the hotel room. They offered free internet, the desk attendants were polite and helpful, and the rooms had a lot of character. The drive in entry way was unique and pleasant. It's actually a great place to take a few pictures of the group too. It was about 1.2 miles to the French Quarter, but they did have a fun street car right in front of the hotel that could get you there quickly. Wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: timelyencounter
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great staff, perfect location. I'll be back....

Reviews.Title: “Unique and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: J4PEACE
Reviews.Content: The streetcar is right outside the front door. The room was large and clean, with a separate room for the toilet and tub from the sink, which had a nice, large vanity counter. Refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, newspaper and a free continental breakfast buffett. The internet was off & on during our stay, but the weather probably contributed to that (high wind, cold, rainy). The staff was exceptionally nice and courteous, and very helpful. I had a convention, and my husband came with me and was basically on vacation- lots for him to do on our first visit to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMandEK
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, fantastic location, quiet (well, we were there right after Mardi Gras), good price, plenty of hot water in our room, comfortable bed, double room a nice size, good breakfast spread in a charming breakfast area. Cons: Housekeeping needs some guidance. We were left short of towels all but one day of our 6 night stay and there were no pillowcases on any of the 8 pillows upon check-in. Housekeeping/maintenance brought us 4 cases when we called, still leaving 4 uncovered. We never did get enough pillowcases. One day our room wasn't made up at all. The vent in the air-conditioner, clearly visible, was filthy and coated in dust/dirt. The vanity has been upgraded, but the bathroom is quite small and the tub in the bathroom was old, dingy, and pretty banged up. Something in the bathroom (maybe the shower curtain) smelled sour. I had to attend a funeral and booked a room at the last minute. We usually visit New Orleans twice a year and stay at the Country Inn & Suites in the CBD, which has nice rooms, a great breakfast, and is a very clean and modern hotel housed in a historic building. Also, the rates are about double the cost of the Maison St. Charles. Country Inn didn't have rooms available this time, but the Maison St. Charles did. Next stay my first choice is still the Country Inn, even at the much higher cost, but the Maison St. Charles isn't bad in a pinch. In sum, you might have to put up with some minor inconveniences like missing towels & pillowcases, but if you're looking for a reasonably clean room in a good location and you're a bargain hunter, this is probably one of your best options in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Almost as nice as the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Nicole001
Reviews.Content: Room was as shown on their website, not the washroom a little run-down. Shower-head partially working. Very clean,and spacious. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hollybr
Reviews.Content: I was so suprised to find a room at this beautiful hotel with such reasonable rates (especially given we stayed during Mardi Gras season). For around $140 we got a room and secure parking. The room was really nicely decorated and felt much more high class then some of the other typical chains I've stayed in in New Orleans. The staff at the front desk was so nice and accomodating. The location was perfect... far enough away from the craziness of the French Quarter but still close enough to not be a pain. It's right on the streetcar route as well. I loved that the hotel wasn't actually a hotel.. it was more like a grouping of older buildings which have been updated. It made the place feel really special. Plus you're right across the street from some nice resturant choices and next door to a killer daquari cafe.... but be warned... the medium daquari will keep you going all night! We plan on staying only at Maison St. Charles from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jlwoo
Reviews.Content: The Maison St. Charles is a great place to stay in New Orleans. It is convenient to the street car and most everything is within walking distance. The staff was very courteous and extremely helpful. I left my glasses and when I called they took the time to locate them, called me back, and arranged to mail them to me. The room had been updated and it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and the courtyard was charming. It was a good value for the money, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: cellogirl
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay when taking my daughter to visit Tulane. This hotel is in a great location, partway between the French Quarter and Tulane. The streetcar right out front took us anywhere we needed to go, cheaply. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The room was spotless and quiet. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cozy & surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Cabin_Luver
Reviews.Content: Right across from Emiril's Del Monaco restuarant and on the main trolley line, this was within walking distance to the French quarter & Jackson Square. We did take a taxi back to the hotel after walking around so much, only because we didn't want to wait for the trolley. For the buildings being as old as they are around New Orleans, the hotel is done in a wonderful palette and the murals on the walls are stunning. Nice courtyard areas to sit & enjoy some quiet by the fountains. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with hotel's management and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Texas_reader
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on recommendations from TripAdvisor and because the hotel offered a park and cruise promotion. I don't plan to stay here again. The most disappointing part of the visit was the lack of compassion by the hotel's night manager. Because of highway construction, rain, and flood, our drive from Houston was long and we were on the highway after dark. My elderly mother and I were tired, concerned for our safety and wanted to stop at a hotel on the road. New Orleans subsequently flooded that night. Because we had confirmed reservations at the St. Charles, which would have had to be cancelled two days previously, we called the hotel. The manager refused to let us out of reservations even though we offered to stay there another night instead. We called Quality Inn to express our concern and they were of no assistance, telling us that it was up to the hotel management if they would let us out of our reservations or not. The lady at the hotel was very friendly, but she was not the manager. Before she hung up, she told us to be safe on the road because the weather was very bad. We drove through two more hours of rain to get there as we didn't want to pay for two hotel rooms. The St. Charles is made up of several older buildings, which can be very charming if the weather is nice. The room was a good size and looked good, but the bathroom was dirty and had several hairs on the floor and in the tub. There was a party on the third floor and people were yelling across the courtyard. The linens were clean and beds were very comfortable. I enjoyed taking the streetcar to get to the French Quarter. We were never told that a breakfast was included with the price and we ended up going out for breakfast. Our keys to the room never worked for us. When we first arrived, we had to walk to the lobby in the rain and through a flooded courtyard to get assistance. Security let us in and gave us new keys. The next day, those keys didn't work either. Shanta at the Front Desk was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and quaint, great service!”
Reviews.Author: glo143
Reviews.Content: having never visited nola before, we were a bit hesitant about the location being somewhat "away" from the french quarter and the "action".. but it turned out to be such a quaint little place with great service and friendly staff, that we loved it! it was only a short 10-min streetcar ride away from the french quarter, and so for its value, totally worth it.. PLUS, it was super close to some great food! Emeril's Delmonico across the street, Cheesecake Bistro a couple blocks away, and the best damn fried chicken i've ever had in my life! (at Popeye's next door!)

Reviews.Title: “Halloween in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: afireinside21
Reviews.Content: First, I recommend going to NOLA for Halloween sometime in your life. It was great! I'm sure Mardi Gras is amazing, and I'm told the parade goes right down St. Charles in front of this hotel, but you might want to check my facts. This hotel was amazing. I work in the hospitality industry and needless to say I'm picky, but also interested in value. I chose this hotel for the price and the location. Of course, our first choice was to stay in the Quarter, but it was much pricier that weekend because of Halloween. I found Masion St. Charles on the Choice Hotels website and it does not do one bit of justice to this hotel! (The property has its own website that will give you a much better look at what you will experience, especially in terms of pictures: maisonstcharles.com.) The streetcar stopped right outside the hotel, which was very convenient for getting to the quarter. When we arrived and checked in, the front desk agents were very helpful with noting that my parents would be checking in separately although the reservations were under my name. As we proceeded to the building we would be staying in (there are several), we were heartily greeted by the property's manager, who offered us assistance in locating our room and told us to contact him if we needed anything during our stay. The standard rooms are pretty comfortable, although not fancy like some of the places you'll find in the Quarter. But we weren't looking for crazy fancy, we were looking for comfortable and functional; the room looked exactly like the photos of the rooms on the website, which is important to me. I get pretty annoyed when I show up to a hotel that depicted a room all dolled up for their website photos, but in reality they look shabby. This was not the case with Maison St Charles. The breakfast was great and always stocked in spite of the relatively heavy traffic they had that weekend. Every morning when we went to breakfast, the breakfast room was full of people and still full of food as well. And it looks cute too--not your typical generic table-and-chair set up. We will return to this property when we visit New Orleans again. It was a great experience with great service. The manager (I feel bad that I can't think of his name!) should be very proud of his property and his city.

Reviews.Title: “convienent to trolly”
Reviews.Author: bltmiami
Reviews.Content: We were given the King Charles Suite, what an overstatement. The room was specious but tired looking. There was an odd assortment of furniture, antiques with a big modern office desk thrown in. The bathroom was ill lit which was a good thing because it was dirty and and falling apart. Stained tub and caulking falling out. The dust behind the night stands was 2 inches thick. All night long there were 2 large haolgen security lights shining in our eyes. The next day I asked for a room change which was granted. We moved rooms in the late afternoon. This one was updated, as pictured in their website and quite lovely. We did call maitance to put a new bulb in the bathroom which worked for a short time and blew again. When I inquiered about the other room I was told the 1st room would be taken out of service for maintenance. The hotel is in the begining of the garden district but quite a distace into the heart of it. The trolly stop was right outside which was fantastic. We ate a delicious fast food bbq restaurant 1 block away. We were not comfortable walking around the hotel area at night. The desk staff was lovely and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really excited about this hotel but would probably not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DLFColumbusOhio
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is one of our all time favorite cities and were looking forward to seeing it again. We had not stayed in this area of New Orleans before so were excited to to be so close to the garden district. Considering the location and age of this hotel I expected it to be old and maybe a little run down so wasn't surprised when it was both of these things. At check in we found the lobby eclectic, charming and inviting. More inviting then the desk clerk who was having a conversation with, I am assuming, a housekeeping manager and seemed annoyed we were interrupting. She may have been having a bad day or whatever but wasn't particularly friendly. We had booked two king suites for two days and ask if we could have rooms on the first floor. She informed us, as if we should have known, that there were no suites on the first floor......(really) she gave us our keys and sent us on our way to our second floor king suite rooms. The concierge, Tony,(very nice guy, I hope he got the tip we left for him at the front desk) greeted us and helped us to our rooms and we tottered up several narrow staircases to rooms 244 and 245. There are stairs everywhere by the way. They were rooms with king beds all right but that where the whole "suite" thing ended. The rooms needed a good cleaning were a bit shabby around the edges but the linens appeared to be clean as were the sink and toilet. As I walked over to look out the window I looked down and saw a very large (2"-3") cock roach on it's back kicking wildly, obviously in it's death throes. I know....south,by the water...roachs..blaa..blaa. I have stayed in the south many times and this is the first time I found a roach in the room. Dead or alive. I went downstairs and explained the situation to Tony and he did take care of it immediately but I was left with a creepy crawly feeling knowing where there is one roach they has to be more. The hotel is on St. Charles street at the edge of the Garden District. The area is very noisy (mostly cars with the bass cranked), it is rich with homeless panhandler types asking for change, trash was everywhere and while I never really felt afraid I did feel unwelcome. In my mind the area has none of the French Quarter ambiance. They did have security on the grounds and everything was well lighted. I would note here that of the 20 or so pages in the hotel information booklet in the room at least 10 of them dealt with personal and property safety. We did have a nice dinner at Zea's, which was down the street a couple of blocks. Zea's specialty was rotisserie meats and was a nice place. The chicken was really good and the grits were yummy. The service was good but again I felt a but unwelcome. I'm a pretty friendly open person, I'm not rude or snobby so was not comfortable with this. The hotel offered a very nice hot breakfast in a interesting little room by the pool. The pool and hot tub looked clean and well care for. The high rating and glowing reviews on Tripadvisor were some of the reasons I chose this hotel for our visit to New Orleans but my personal experience at this hotel was a disappointment. We had booked for two nights but after one decided we were ready to check out. The front desk clerk was very nice and waive the parking fee when I explained about our little "friend" in the room. An additional note about New Orleans, for those that think this city has recovered from the storm you would be wrong. It is heartbreaking to see how many buildings are still boarded up and how things have deteriorated. It's a city hanging on by it's fingertips. It's lifeblood is tourism, to ever recover to it's former glory it must have the tourist trade but I felt, for want of a better word, resentment from some of the natives, that people could come and party and ignore the devastation. New Orleans is a great city, I wish it well!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: tiedwithasmile
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in New Orleans and my sister's first (it was her birthday present). The location of the hotel was great, about half way between everything we wanted to see - Garden District, Zoo, French Quarter, Riverwalk - and right on the streetcar line. The room was great, and even without a dresser we were able to set our clothes up on the spacious shelves under the sink area. There were plenty of towels when we arrived and having an individual air conditioning unit made it easy to set the sleeping temp of the room. There were only two things I didn't really like in the room and they are minute things. There was slight mildew on the bottom of the shower curtain from the material resting against the tub while drying and the side of the microwave was bent so we weren't confident on using it. Staff wise, everyone was very helpful and a friendly. Tony, head of security (I believe) even made it a point to talk to us as we were moving our luggage out to leave at the end of the trip. The staff even had a small pumpkin carving contest and asked the guests to vote on the winner. A very nice "family oriented" way to keep everyone involved. This will definitely be the place that I stay on any future visits to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Great service, but crap room.”
Reviews.Author: Elton74
Reviews.Content: I expected this place to be quaint, but once we walked into our room (more like closet) all I saw was crap. Nice flat screen on the wall, but nowhere to put our clothes, luggage, etc. No writing desk. There was no cold water from the tap, so I purchased a case of bottled water. The tub was chipping and dirty, and the shower head was weak and pathetic. Outside, the hotel was very nice and cute aesthetically. The service was exceptional and very kind and helpful. Free, secure parking! For the price and location to the street car I suppose I would stay here again. But I'll opt for a pricier room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Small Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hoss30
Reviews.Content: This Hotel had a Great Location to be in New Orleans, a Trolley ride to all the prime spots. I booked my room from Oct 16-18 for a weekend getaway with the wife, upon arrival I couldnâ€™t believe how small my room was. This room was the size of my guest bathroom at home. I tried to upgrade my room several times complaining, but the staff blew me off and said they were overbook and had to send other reservation to different hotels(WTF). So to avoid hearing my wife mouth all night, I had to hang out at casino during the night (Luckily I was a big winner :>) ) So do not book a room over the internet call and upgrade to their Suite's they looked pretty nice..... O yea the internet in the lobby was broken!!! So bring your wireless laptop if you want to get on the internet!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: greenjellybean
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It certainly is not the Ritz, but it was clean and comfortable. The beds and pillows were comfortable, linens clean. Parking on premises is $17/day, but that is less than most public parking lots and even with the additional $17 this was still the best value hotel wise. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nearby (short walk) places to eat are Wendy's (next door), Voodoo Barbeque, St Charles Tavern, Zea's, a Japanese steakhouse, a Chinese restaurant, Burger King, and a few others that I can't remember the name of. We ate dinner at Zea's, and both breakfast and dinner at the St Charles Tavern. Zea's was good (3.5/5). St Charles Tavern was passable for breakfast (2/5) and the burgers we had for dinner were very good (4/5 for burger only - 2/5 for service, etc). St Charles Tavern is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: msim42
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Parking is "through" and to the back of the hotel. That through us for a loop, but I would definitely go back. It is an older, historic facility, but everything was kept up well. Service was great, room temperature was fine. The complimentary breakfast had an excellent choice of hot and cold items. The location is perfect. Several restaurants right next door or within two blocks. Trolley stop right outside. Hotwire price was an extremely great bargain. Pool and Hot tub were clean. All staff members were friendly and efficient. Hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BETSRN
Reviews.Content: The Maison St. Charles exceeded all my expectations. It is a lovely, eclectic (all gated) hotel with a street car stop right at the front door. It is within the Garden District where one can hop on the street car and ride all the way up St. Charles Street and look at all the beautiful homes and mansions along the way. Take a peek at Tulane and Loyola Universities while you are in the area. Then, hop back on that street car and ride the other way and you can be in the French Quarter in about 15 minutes. Thanks to Tony and all the other wonderful staff at the Maison St. Charles for making our vacation in new orleans such a memorable experience. Do NOT miss taking a "Katrina Tour" done by Grayline bus. Also, try and take a swamp tour (Cajun Encounters). Two restaurants which we really liked (for atmosphere AND excellent local foods) was Court of Two Sisters (in the French Quarter) and Upperline (in the Garden District). We also tried Brennan's (in the French Quarter). The food and service were excellent, but you have to really like eggs to enjoy the brunch. I would not go back to eat there again.;

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikenola
Reviews.Content: The Maison St. Charles is the best Hotel in New Orleans. Being a Native New Orleans, now living in Houston, Texas, I know two things, good food and good hotels. The hotel rivals some of the more upscale Hotels, The Ritz Carlton, The W, but even better because of its location. It is located right on what HGTV calls a "Dream Drive-St. Charles Ave." You have access to the Historic Street Car which will take you to the New Orleans French Quarter and many restaurants including Emeril's Delmonico which is one block away-a short walk. You really won't need a rental car if you stay here because you are close to everything. Once on the property you will feel at home. The rooms are very plush, some with flat screens, high ceilings (some feels like 14 foot ceilings) with the Historic French Charm of New Orleans. Some of the rooms have high end antique furniture. For the prices the rooms are a steal--You are getting a lot for the Price. When I arrived on the property, I felt as if I was swept away to a European vacation. The court yards were a dream and I just loved the staff. They were very attentive to our needs, always asking did we need anything. I was able to use the business center right in the lobby which was very convenient and they even had WiFi and high speed internet. The breakfast was awesome and over the top. I felt the southern hospitality throughout my entire stay. My family also hosted a Baby Shower in my honor at the hotel. We had the best time ever. If I were having an event in New Orleans, Maison St. Charles would be 1st on the list. The meeting room was very large and accomodated about 80 to 90 guest. I loved the sconces on the wall, the beautiful vintage furniture, and the lighting was perfect. The room was like a dream--I would not have hosted my event any other place. My guest stated that it was the best baby shower that they ever attended. This day was a dream come true thanks to Maison St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Suite, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: lepapillion
Reviews.Content: Being a NOLA native I have stayed at many area hotels. Found this online, we stayed in the Iberville Suite. The suites are gorgeus and very big, in the style of a creole shotgun house NOLA is known for!! High ceilings, living room, chandeleirs,and sofa bed, refrigerator, etc. The street car stops right in front and goes to the French Qarter or Garden district. Parking in the French Quarter is expensive and hard to find. The room was clean and well maintained. The free contiental breakfast was great. The grounds are very safe and have a gate that locks after dark. I peaked into the regular rooms and they are much bigger than a standard hotel room at other chains. Pet Friendly. Front Desk helpful and polite. WE will now stay here when ever we are in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: Tazaemon
Reviews.Content: I typically find that larger city hotels have higher prices. However, I did manage to find this hotel and stayed (with parking included) for two nights under $200. The hotel is located very close to the highway and the St. Charles streetcar has a stop immediately outside the hotel willing to whisk you away to the CBD, the Garden District or the bawdy French Quarter. The service was exceptional with staff helping me out finding good restaurants and various other things to do in the area (other than my planned itinerary). The breakfast supplied was varied and good quality. And the hotel room itself was clean and was away from the main street so I heard almost no noise at night (mind you I wasn't here during Mardi Gras!) For a chain hotel in New Orleans located outside the French Quarter in terms of cleanliness, value, rooms, service and location, you will likely not find any better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wish the wireless internet worked”
Reviews.Author: ZWheeler
Reviews.Content: I can't say much more than the other reviewers. Our room was large, clean and had a very comfortable bed. The purple pierrot motif was very New Orleans and a nice change from standard hotel decor. The only problem, (besides paying a higher rate than we were accustomed to in New Orleans,) was that the wireless internet did not work in our room or our friend's room next door. We were given a number for technical support, but they were not able to help. I chose the hotel partially based on having free wireless in the room so the lack of this amenity was a major let down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: over1861
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this Quality Inn on St Charles Ave. It appears to have been renovated but the rooms were nice and clean in any case. The office is separated from the rooms by a court yard. It is very secure. There is a high fence around the property but it is fairly well hidden. They have a security officer out near the rooms. We arrived about 9pm and the desk called the security officer and he met us half way and escourted us to our room. The St Charles Avenue area is in and near the Garden District and does not appear to be a high crime area. But it is New Orleans and the security at the Maison St. Charles was welcome. The courtyard between the office and the rooms is very well kept. There is a large fountain and the area is well landscaped with numerous flowers. You cannot beat this hotel for the price. The streetcar track runs right in front of the hotel. Great! The World War II museam is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Copperdesk63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 9 JazzFests in a row. The rooms are nicer now than before and it is a great location for going to the Fairgrounds and the many music venues all over the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seattleite97
Reviews.Content: I came down to tour Tulane Law School with my father and stayed four nights at the Maison St. Charles. We loved this place! The rooms were beautiful and very clean, and the maids tidied up splendidly while we were out and about for the day. The continental breakfast was average, but the poolside dining area was lovely, as was the decor of the lobby and the over-all layout of the hotel. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The place is also ideally situated on the streetcar line, making heading downtown or uptown very convenient - no need to rent a car if you are staying here. It was a short walk to nice restaurants nearby, including the Daquiri shop on the corner which serves strong, refreshing drinks to go. All and all, a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler50
Reviews.Content: I have been to New Orleans many times. Each hotel I choose is better then the next. This one goes to the top of the list. The front desk staff is exceptional. Friendly and cheerfull with a willingness to help make your stay something to remember. In fact, every employee I met always greeted we with a smile and seemed proud of their contribution to the guest's stay. The hotel is made up of serveral buildings with each having it's own courtyard. I lucked out as my room was near the pool. I don't swim but a nice soak in the hot tub at the end of the day was great. My room seemed newly refurbished and while purlple is not my favorit color, the room was larger then i had expected. I did find the lack of a chest of drawers a liittle odd however there was lots of shelf room under the vanity. I suppose you could put items there but I used the end tables. My stay was right after Jazz Fest and before graduations and big conventions so it seemed I had the place to myself as it was so quiet. The breakfast room is by the pool. I enjoyed the coffee, muffins, yougurt, juice, toast and cereal. They also had hard boiled eggs and fruit. The streetcar stop is conveniant but I preferred walking. There are lots of places to eat close by from Wendy's (next door) to Emerils Delmonico (across the street). A short walk gets you pizza or barbeque. A bit further is Copeland's Cheesecake Biistro. A longer stroll gets you to Border's Books and an almost unrecognizable McDonald's. A friendly staff. A clean room A quiet stay. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Maison St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: Jackson6
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. I booked 2 suites and a single for co-workers and myself for a convention in town. The Mardi Gras suite is in the main building has a balcony overlooking St. Charles.It's the balcony you see in the pictures of the hotel front. Suite #250/251 is in the courtyard area. We opted for this hotel instead of a traditional hotel room so that we would all have our own bedrooms while being reasonably priced. Knowing a streetcar stop was right out the front door was also a selling point. If you are looking for somewhere unique with plenty of space and privacy yet close to The French Quarter for a reasonable price...this is the place for you. if you are looking for a typical hotel room with the same predicatbllity a hotel chain offers, this is not it. These rooms are decorated with antique furniture. I had a beautiful and confortable 4 post bed and an armoires served as a closet. Both bedrooms as well as the living area had up to date t.v's. My suite was on the second floor and because this is a house, there is no elevator so if you have physical limitations, take that into account. The porch was well kept and overlooked a very quaint courtyard. The 3 resident cats were also nice to see and added to the envirnment. Continental breakfast was adequate and it was nice to not have to purchase breakfast out. The staff were very friendly. I would defintely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before going on a cruise out of New Olreans. This place is in a great location, trolley stops right out front. The breakfast was good and plentiful. The staff was very informative on things around the hotel and where you should and shouldn't walk at night. I never felt uncomfortable in the area of this hotel as there were plenty of other tourists walking around. The room was comfortable and clean as was the grounds of the hotel. This was the first time in New Orleans and I feel I couldn't of picked a better hotel for our stay. The only bad thing about this place is on the website it states that there is a bar on the property. There is not, they said that it has been closed for sometime now. Also, the hot tub by the pool wasn't working properly and being in March the pool was cold (to be expected). There was a St. Patrick's Day parade down the street towards the Garden District that was in walking distance (5 blocks). If your down there at that time I would highly recommend going to it. We ate at the Voodoo BBQ restaurant (walking distance) which was wonderful. I didn't think I would eat at a BBQ restaurant in New Orleans, thinking more Cajun, but this place is wonderful. When we got to the hotel we parked the car and didn't drive the whole time we were there. The trolley takes you right down to the French Quarter and the other way towards the garden district. We did have to wait a little for one, but not very long. $1.25 exact change or having a family of 4 like us, it would take a $5.00 bill. If you are looking for a great place to stay with kids/teenagers, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a nicer place!”
Reviews.Author: cyndy815
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mardi Gras 2009 and couldn't have selected a better location for our family to view the parades. We walked out the front door and were there! My daughter-in-law and I took my 2 year old and 4 year old grandchildren down for the event and we were so glad we chose Maison St. Charles. It was clean, the employees were so friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good, the beds comfy...what more could you ask for? Yes, I have stayed in more elegant hotels before...but we were not looking for elegance this time. We were looking for a good price and clean rooms and we got both. This is where I will be staying from now on when I visit in New Orleans! We all loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff....best kept secret in New Orelans!”
Reviews.Author: maw0509
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a business trip and had booked a room at the Maison St. Charles due to its close proximity to where I needed to be for work. I was there for just one night, but my experience at this hotel was very memorable. The location is great....it's in the Garden District and itâ€™s just a 5 minute drive to the French Quarter. The trolley runs right in front of the hotel and cabs are also plentiful in the area. If you have your own car, the hotel has ample parking for their guests. Thereâ€™s even enough parking for tour busesâ€¦..which is apparently very rare in that area. There are several restaurants and some shops that are walking distance from the hotel, too. For those that are looking for a hotel to stay at during Mardi Gras, I would definitely suggest this one. It is along the parade route of several parades. I actually got to see one the evening I stayed there, which was very cool and unexpected. The staff was awesomeâ€¦..very friendly and helpful. Even the hotel manager was interacting with the guests staying there. He suggested several restaurants close by that me and my colleague could eat at, and he kept us updated on when the parade would be coming by the hotel so we could see it. The hotel itself is very charming and unique. I stayed in one of their suites, which is actually part of a historical home built in the 1840â€™s. It was very spaciousâ€¦..full living room, bedroom, kitchenette area, and 2 bathrooms. I was informed by the staff that my room (# 126) is apparently haunted. I didnâ€™t see any ghosts that night (of course, I slept with a light on), but some of the staff and other guests have experienced ghost sightings. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel. Itâ€™s affordable, in a great location, the staff is great, and itâ€™s very charming. I will definitely stay there again the next time Iâ€™m in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People - But Should Have Been Closed For Construction”
Reviews.Author: princedylan
Reviews.Content: I'll stick to the facts: Paid $85 per night for a queen deluxe. Stayed 4 nights. Room was located mere feet from a filthy janitor's closet from which a team of hotel employees emerged noisily and ceaselessly each day beginning at 8:00am and and ending sometime in the afternoon, banging their carts into the door and leaving bags of rank garbage and cleaning equipment in the pathway. The nearby corner nook resembled a makeshift toilet found in the alley of some Third World country, stained and always filthy - a place that if you dropped a ten dollar bill you might just leave it. But this is nothing. A large portion of the hotel was under construction and unoccupied, so there were no rooms to move to. All night long forklifts hummed and beeped and things crashed and rattled about 60 feet from our room. It was so absurd it was almost funny. Almost. The pool area is great too if you're an unsavory looking character who likes to stay up all hours playing dominoes, cussin', and suckin' down daiquaris. The oddest thing of all is that the employees thought nothing of the construction madness, the noise and mess - and when I pulled the car around to load up the bags I was barked at and forced to park my car on the street and push everything up the block. Bizarre. The room itself: average size, had no cold water, and the air conditioning maxed out at around 70 degrees - which is just a touch too warm. The TV was 17 or 19-inch - quite a splurge... Not! All in all, it was a strange place to stay and I will never in a million years return. The location is great, however. Surely the hotel's owner is either a world class slime bag or just doesn't give a hoot. Hey! It's New Orleans - who cares about cleanliness and quiet!?

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel w/great customer service”
Reviews.Author: this2shallpass
Reviews.Content: When you drive up to the hotel it seems like it could be in a bad neighborhood but it isn't bad at all. It is located in the Garden District which is about 5 minutes from the French Quarter. I experienced excellent customer service from everyone I encountered. The rooms were simple but adequate. I brought a cat, so they were pet friendly too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome city, great place to stay, but don't drink the water”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheSunset
Reviews.Content: I would gladly have given this hotel a five star rating, but I'm absolutely certain that all of us - including our dog - got sick from the hotel water. What's worse is that they wouldn't respond to our e-mail complaint about it. Anyway, aside from 5 days of diarrhea following our stay, we really enjoyed this hotel and the city of New Orleans. The staff were nice and helpful, the hotel was really cool, and the street car stop couldn't have been more convenient. Breakfast was pretty good, and we liked checking out the hotel grounds in the evening. The place is dog-friendly, which was a requirement for us. You can tell that the buildings are old, but I found it charming. Everything worked fine, and the room was very comfortable. The hotel chain bought all the buildings on a city block and turned them into hotel rooms. So breakfast is in one building, laundry is in another, check-in is in another, and so on. It's pretty neat to walk to the various buildings and see the different architecture, plants, etc. Everything is gated in, and I felt pretty safe, even in the evening. There is a great restaurant about 7 blocks from the hotel. I think it was called the Cheesecake Bistro. It was fantastic. I definitely recommend grabbing a drink or bite to eat there. We also took the street cars into the French Quarter several times. We walked around by the Mississippi, visited Bourbon Street, and checked out a really pretty cathedral. We had a blast drinking on Bourbon Street at night. Every single thing we ate was amazing. The food can't be beat. Even the greasy pub we stopped at had awesome fries. I definitely recommend this hotel and visiting New Orleans. Just an important tip... don't drink the water!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: evilwebqueen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and it's still the same great place. Clean, big rooms in 3-story buildings, clustered around courtyards. We overlooked the pool. The St. Charles streetcar stops right out front. The free continental breakfast is yummy. The front desk staff personnel are very polite and helpful. And it's cheap! $80 a night. The grounds are gated and guest parking is in an adjacent gated lot so there aren't a bunch of cars right next to your room door. Our room had a minifridge and microwave and they have free wireless. There's a bathroom area counter outside the shower/toilet room for plenty of dressing area. Our room had two queen beds, dresser, desk, table and two upholstered chairs and wasn't cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately recommendable”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the positive recommendations, and while it didn't quite meet my expectations it is OK when you know what you're dealing with. The location is reasonably convenient with a tram stop right in front of the hotel, but the neighborhood itself didn't make a particularly safe impression. Front desk staff wasn't overly helpful; we had to haggle for fifteen minutes to get decent rooms after they initially wanted to dump us in dirty ones right next to the extremely noisy pool. Our final rooms were decent, but note that you're dealing here with what is essentially a motel one notch up from Motel 6 - so stained carpets and bed spreads should be expected. In terms of value for money (we paid about $80) I don't complain - but it certainly isn't the fairytale inn some other reviewers have painted it as.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nic32585
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel originally not knowing what it was; we booked the "surprise" package. We were expecting something decent, but this hotel is amazing. I loved everything about it, from the location to the friendly staff. I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Visit New Orleans, but consider staying somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Grovemontjanet
Reviews.Content: The Maison St. Charles has its upside - it is convenient, but at #24 this hotel is ranked too high on TripAdvisor. At the price (about $90) you're getting what you pay for . The hotel is located across from the streetcar stop and Emeril's Delmonico restaurant, but guests should be aware of surroundings in the general neighborhood. The hotel does have visible security and secure parking lots. We had several problems with our room including no towels and missing light bulbs and malfunctioning lamps, old and stained linen. The bathroom smelled of mildew. Front desk staff were flip and less than helpful, but the manager was responsive to our complaints. He said that a major renovation is planned, and the hotel may be worth a second look after it's done. Be sure to visit the Audubon Zoo and ride the streetcar from start to finish. Watch the Mississippi roll by behind the Cafe DuMonde. Eat at Mothers, the Palace Cafe and find a little neighborhood place like Liuzza's. Walk the uptown streets and shop on Magazine street. Browse the antique stores on Royal Steet for the best of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed the Maison St Charles!”
Reviews.Author: Debikg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maison St Charles 4/20 - 4/25 and had a nice time. Hotel is very homey and the staff was FANTASTIC! Valerie at the front desk and a gentleman who helped with luggage & taxies- sorry I forgot his name - were so helpful and extremely kind. Will definitely stay again. Keep in mind that because this is an older hotel, there is no elevator. There are only two floors but carrying luggage up two floors was a treat at midnight! Two french women own 75% of the hotel with the other 25% being recently purchased by Quality Inn who is putting $2 million of updates into the property. Eat at "Slice" which is two blocks from the hotel on the same side of the street. FANTASTIC food. It is a pizzaria/bistro with a lot more than just pizza. Everything we tried from their salads, desserts and pizza were fantastic. The service was outstanding. Their professional chef makes great 4 course meals to include wine. Best value and food in the area. Loved the Garden District and the wonderful people! Deb & Art

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: irongrrl22
Reviews.Content: The Maison St. Charles is a delightful, affordable hotel in the Garden District in New Orleans. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable with free wireless internet. I loved the pool and spa, and the continental breakfast was substantial with surprisingly healthy options (New Orleans is not known for its health food). The hotel service was great, I was always easily accommodated no matter what I needed. There is a street car line basically at the hotel's front door and it will take you to the French Quarter, but I preferred the 20-minute walk. I have no complaints about the Maison St. Charles, and I highly recommend it to those traveling to New Orleans for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Citprof
Reviews.Content: Great price, clean room, visible security, great location, quiet, friendly & helpful staff. I liked coming home at night and stopping in the lobby for a cup of tea! Just can't beat the streetcar & bus stops across the street. So easy to hop on the streetcar & get dropped of right at Canal & Bourbon! Get the visitor's pass to jump on & off the streetcar, I had a great time doing this. Took the streetcar down to the Garden District, jumped off at Audobon Park, took a nice stroll, back on the streetcar to the end where there was a really nice little cafe Le Madeleines, fresh pastries, tea. then back on the streetcar! 3 blocks down, super restaurant, Zea! Give it a try. I was in town just a short time before/after cruise, but can't wait to go back! New Orleans is so beautiful and very easy to get around! Between walking & the convenient public transportation, no cars needed! As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe & secure at the Maison St. Charles, and actually the whole time I was in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TxNurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3/15 for one night prior to departing on a cruise. I had a really hard time finding hotels under $200 since it was Spring Break. I luckily found this one, and paid $112 with tax, plus $14/night for parking. The hotel is on St. Charles, the trolley stops right in front of hotel. Emeril's Delmonico steak house is directly across the street. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is completely gated, had 2 security guards on duty. Nice courtyard, numerous people hanging out---quietly! drinking and talking. I never felt unsafe, even walking at night to eat. The room was your usual mid price hotel room, clean, with comfy beds. I had no problems with the room. We had second floor. There are 3 levels, with elevators. Went down just to view the free cont. breakfast, and it was very lacking. Basically fruit, muffins, and toast. But we were eating at Cafe Dumond, so it did not affect us. I would definately stay here again, and would recommend to others. Again, average hotel, not the Hilton. Very quaint, cute buildings, with nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: timbolester
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint old place. The websites (including Trip Advisor) make it difficult to fully get the "vibe" of it. First, we had no problems with the staff. Everyone was polite and accommodating. I called the front desk for extra pillows and they were delivered in less than 5 minutes. The hotel is made of of several different buildings. Some were old houses and others are more "run-of-the-mill" hotel type buildings. We were in one of the smaller buildings (room 247). The room was relatively comfortable but extremely SMALL. There was one double bed, one chair and one small desk. There was a closet built into the wall but there was no bureau of any kind (meaning no drawers -- anywhere). There were hardwood floors (a nice touch). They offer a free continental breakfast that starts at 6:30 AM on weekdays and 7:00 on weekends. If you are an early riser (as I am), there is NO WHERE to go before that. The area is a little questionable; even the front desk advised me not to walk around too much in the dark, so you are out of luck if you want something other than the yucky in-room coffee. There are some restaurants around (some nice, some fast food) but they don't open early either. For a nice dinner I highly recommend Emeril's Delmonico. It is right across the street and is great. It's a little pricey but the service and food are terrific. Although it is nice, we saw people there dressed in jeans (but no tacky T shirts), so I guess there really isn't a dress code. There is a scary neighborhood bar (The Daiquiri Bar, I think...) with some homeless-looking people hanging around, about a block away from the hotel. Be careful where you go. There is a trolley stop right outside the hotel which is very handy for seeing the local sights. We bought an all-day pass (from the front desk) for $5.00 each. Well worth it! All in all I recommend it, but don't expect anything too fancy. It is somewhat reminiscent of an old-time Key West guest house. No frills but everything you need. Just be careful where you go at night.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Stay Away from the Hubbub”
Reviews.Author: GHillTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a good place to stay for my husband and I while attending a convention at the Morial Convention Center and spending some time sightseeting. It was about a 15 minute walk to the convention center, which wasn't bad at all. Along the way, you can walk passed the Civil War Museum (unfortunately for us, it is temporarily closed) and the National WWII Museum (where we easily spent 3 hours one day). The street car can be picked up right outside the hall, which is handy if you want to get a ride close to the French Quarter. Across the street is a very tasty restaurant, Emeril's Delmonico (highly recommend), and there are several casual eateries along the street. The pizza at Slice was very good, for example. As for the hotel itself, the staff was pleasant, and the room was clean. The furnishings were a bit dated (peach-colored tub, small TV), but the hotel did offer free wireless internet! The beds were a bit worn and swayback. There is a coffee maker in the room, but they also offer a free continental breakfast, which was pretty good: Coffee, juice, cereals, variety of breads and pastries, fresh fruit, boiled eggs. The grounds are pretty, but some areas can do with some cleanup (like the area by the elevator near our room, 219). Also, the doors to the room are to the outside, which can make for some noise in the night as revelers return. Overall, it was a good place to stay if you are on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: mslarue72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend and while our room (141) was tiny it was a nice stay. This hotel is a nice spot, neat courtyards, extremely pleasant staff and is right on the st. charles street car line. It is only about a 15 minute walk to the quarter. We stayed with some friends and when they first checked into their room the toilet didn't work and it was clearly a smoking room (they had requested non). The staff quickly changed their room. We hung out in the hotel bar the first night and had some mean Hurricanes made by Liz. Stop by and say hi! It was a bit noisy in our room on Saturday but our friends didn't hear anything in their building. Would probably helped if we weren't an end room but nothing that was unbearable or went on for any lenght. Plus it is Mardi Gras time so....... :-) Woudl stay here again but no more than a few nights. Older hotel that could use a little upgrading but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian
Reviews.Content: A nice and interesting place to stay, now that the St. Charles Streetcar is running (it stops right in front). Composed of several older and newer buildings around courtyards. Great access to Vieux Carre and to the Garden District. Croissants are on (the included) continental breakfast buffet. Parking is reasonable, but try the street first; you may avoid the nightly fee. Restaurants are nearby, from fast food to neighborhood bars to Japanese to one of the Emeril's establishments for those with deep pockets. A short streetcar ride to the heart of the Garden District and many restaurant opportunities within a short walk. The only glitch in our stay: for three days the front desk couldn't come up with a TV channel list missing from our room. Still, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel away from the action”
Reviews.Author: tyco
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Sugar Bowl. Very close to the Superdome, about a 10 minute walk. Took the streetcar which stops right in front of the hotel to Canal Street to go to the French Quarters. If you want to be close to the French Quarters and to where all the action is, then you should stay on Canal Street. Average hotel, no frills but free continental breakfast was nice with pastries, bagels, and yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcoDallas
Reviews.Content: A wonderful staying in this hotel, courtyards & patios on the evening 're charming with the friendlyness of the staff ! We'll come back here next year!

Reviews.Title: “comfy ,a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: deebAl
Reviews.Content: Don't let the exterior put you off. We were there 2 nights and the only complaint is the plumbing. Perhaps the rain had something to do with it but nevertheless annoying. They came quickly when called. If you want fancy it's not for you. It IS lovely in the courtyard with the bar and pool . The price and free parking of this hotel make it a great find . The room was larger than hotels we have stayed in New Orleans for twice the price. We will definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “What a great place and staff!--Come back to NOLA and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ZydecoGal
Reviews.Content: Several of us came back to our New Orleans birthplace the first time after Katrina for a family wedding Oct. 06. We didn't know what to expect. When we pulled up at the exterior of the Maison St. Charles, we questioned our decision to stay there. That uncertainty didn't last long as the facade was misleading. Although this is not a 4 star hotel with designer furniture, the grounds are immaculately groomed by Cookie and beautiful. The housekeeping staff does a great job of keeping the rooms tidy. Diane will make you feel right at home in the on site lounge (be sure to ask her how she got her 2002 employee of the year award). Security by Tony couldn't be any better, and Kathy, the reservations manager, adjusted our room rates downward voluntarily because there had been a price adjustment after our reservations were made. I'm sorry for leaving out anybody else as the staff was all friendly and bent over backward to ensure we had a pleasant stay. I appreciated the wi fi in the lobby and business center where I could check my email while enjoying the bottomless pot of fresh Community Coffee and a muffin available in the lobby every morning. There are good restaurants nearby. Voodoo Barbeque's ribs are to die for, and the crawfish etouffee omelet at the St. Charles Tavern tastes just as good at 1 a.m. as at 10 . You can hoof it to the interesting shops on Magazine street where there are unbelievable bargains. Everybody, please come back to New Orleans if you want to help this amazing American city and its residents. They need tourists. Although my heart breaks to see some of the devastated areas, Katrina largely spared the French Quarter and the beautiful Garden district. The art museum is open again and is world class. The majestic live oaks in City Park are recouperating. The music on Frenchman Street is wonderful, even on a Sunday night. And when you come back, check out this little gem of a hotel as your base and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Change of Pace from normal hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maison St. Charles on May 29th for 5 nights. We are trying to reestablish ourselves in New Orleans so our stay was primarily business, i.e. checking on our house, meeting with contractors and visiting family. I booked this hotel on the choice privileges website and due to a pricing glitch got a steal of a deal on their 2 bedroom suite, The Robert E. Lee suite. Check-in was quick and the staff was friendly. Parking at this time was free and is a lot across the street. The room was a two bedroom suite with a King bed in one room and a double bed in the other bedroom. It also has a sofasleeper in the living room. The room on arrival was not as clean as I like. One of the bathrooms was a little dirty and the carpet was filthy. I think since this room normally goes for $275 a night and probably had not been used recently, I think that's why the room was not as clean. Had I been paying that rate I would have left shortly after arriving. Since I was getting the room at a steal, I contacted the front desk staff who was very nice about everything. They said to make a list of all our problems and they would remedy the next day which they did. They came in and did a thourough cleaning the next day. They even removed the dirty oriental rug and shampooed the carpet. Maid service at this time was only on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturday, so be aware of that. The rooms are quaint and a change from typical hotels, so if you like that style of hotel, this place is for you. There's no elevator. Our room was the entire second floor of one of the buidlings, so be prepared to climb stairs. For our family of five including 3 small children we had adequate space. There are also 3 TVs, one in each room which is a must have with children. Our room came with fridge and microwave. Just be aware also if you are travelling with others and seeking privacy, don't let anyone use the sofabed. There is no covering on top of the master bedroom door, it's an open window. There is a lounge and pool if you want drinks, but no restaurant open at this time. There are fast food and neighborhood restaurants nearby since this is St Charles avenue, so eating out is not a problem. Just be prepared for lines like most restaurants Post Katrina. I would recommend for someone looking for a change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you made it through katrina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Twelve family members stayed here for my daughter's graduation from Tulane. This was my second stay in the hotel and we had hoped to come back. All of your staff was great. Hope everyone is safe and the hotel made it through Katrina. God bless you all and hope we can see you soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maison St. Charles on July 11-July 14, and I couldn't have been more pleased. It is the perfect location if you don't want to be to close to the hustle and bustle of the French Quarters or Bourbon Street. The streetcar passes right in front of the hotel, which is a definite plus. Although the first day we were there we got on the streetcar going the wrong way, the driver was nice enough to give us passes to ride the streetcar back in the right direction. But the scenery down St. Charles is great. The rooms may not have been spectacular but they were clean and roomy enough for me and my two girls. There is a safe in each room, that was another plus. Our room overlooked a nice courtyard that was quiet and there was always security on duty 24 hours a day. There is also valet parking. All vehicles are placed in a secure gated lot. The regular rate for parking is $14.00 a day, which isnâ€™t bad, compared to some of the fees charges around the city for parking. Of course I received a great deal online from the hotelsâ€™ web site. We paid $91.00 per night, the third night was free and parking was half price. The pool is great and there is a spa. One block down is a fantastic tavern called "St. Charles Tavern" that serves New Orleans style dishes (seafood, steaks, etc); and the prices are reasonable. My girls can be very picky when it comes to eating away from home, but they loved it so much we ate there two nights in a row. The streets have good lighting so we never felt unsafe walking at night. There are other places to eat right next door and across the street. Most of all the entire staff was very friendly and helpful. What a remarkable group of people. When I am in New Orleans again I will definitely staff at the Maison St. Charles again. We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were assigned to a 1st floor room next to the ice machine. The room itself wasnt anything special and the one thing i remember about this room was that my husband had to kill a spider that was in his words "huge". He's not usually scared of bugs but this was pretty bad. Luckily, I didnt see it. The grounds were really neat. They looked like a little village and at nite it was all lit up. They also had a hot tub that my husband enjoyed. The location isnt that great if you want to go to the french quarter. We ended up getting on the wrong streetcar going in the opposite direction - not happy. I dont think I' would stay here again mainly because of the location. Its nice to be able walk out of the hotel and you are in the french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: pooka54
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Maison St. Charles for three days in February prior to sailing on a crusie. We had a marvelous time on our first trip to New Orleans. The hotel looked a little shabby when we first pulled up in a taxi, but we were pleasantly surprised upon entering the grounds. This charming little hotel is as close to living in a gated community as I will ever get. The hotel is situated within easy reach of the entire city as there is a streetcar stop right outside the front door. We bought a three day transit pass at the bank across the street and off we went. When we weren't riding the rails, we were walking St. Charles Avenue and never felt threatened or uncomfortable. The room was your typical hotel room, but it was the fantastic staff that made the Maison St. Charles such a great place to stay. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We had plently of typical tourist questions, but they always had a smile and a wealth of information to share. We wish that we only had enough time to try all of their recommendations. Thanks to "Hurricane" Gene in the bar, Jennifer & Barbara at the Front Desk, and all of the other staff whose names we can not recall... Y'all made our first trip to New Orleans memorable and when we come back we will definitely stay with you again!

Reviews.Title: “Has taken a down turn”
Reviews.Author: RaginCajun1
Reviews.Content: This used to be our favorite accommodations but during our resent stay that changed. The facility is in need of an update. The rooms are aged, carpets worned and bath fixtures dirty. The area around the Maison has also taken a down turn. There is now a bar across the side street where undesirables are hanging around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient location, good price and good service”
Reviews.Author: trulyatraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. It was really my third choice because the other two had breakfast included but they were booked up. You can't see much from the street but once they take you to your room it is really quite charming - a lot of separate buildings each with their own courtyard equipped with tables and chairs. You can grab a croissant from La Patisserie next door and have your breakfast outside. I'd say the rooms are average but I'm not there to sit in a hotel room anyway. You are right on the streetcar line which for $1.25 will take you downtown or the other way to the garden district. There is every possible kind of restaurant you would want within a 3 block walk - fast food, French, Japanese, Italian, bar food, BBQ, Emeril's, etc. I recommend the St. Charles Inn - a bar that's open 24 hrs. and has huge portions, and the BBQ place across the street that I forgot the name of. We ate at the St. Charles 3 times! The hotel staff was friendly - especially the valet!

Reviews.Title: “improved maison st. charles”
Reviews.Author: beth c
Reviews.Content: we had stayed at maison st charles sept. 2004, and i had written an unfavorable review. we were in new orleans again april 20,2005. we decided to give maison st. charles another shot. i'm glad we did . we had a wonderful stay. our room was great and tony the valet-security guy is always so helpful. the only thing wrong is the front desk lady still doesn't go out of her way for the guests, but other than that, i would recomend this hotel again. they have improved and have done some renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Maison St Charles Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CarolVBrady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maison St Charles for 11 nights from 15 - 26 March. It was our first time in New Orleans, and even in the USA, and we loved every minute of our holiday. The hotel was lovely - we had a standard room, but the furnishings were very smart and tasteful, with 2 queen-sized solid wood beds. The maids kept the room spotlessly clean, so I can't understand a previous poster's comments that the hotel is a "filthy dump". I'm with Cromette on this one! La Madeleine is wonderful, and the staff efficient and friendly - I highly recommend the yogurt parfait for breakfast, and the Sacha Torte if you really fancy spoiling yourself for dessert! Go to the St Charles Tavern also, for a great cheap breakfast, lively and attentive service, and great deals on dinner! We always felt perfectly safe walking round on St Charles Avenue both day and night - and the people in New Orleans are great, so polite and accommodating. In short, do stay at the Maison St Charles, it's fantastic value for money and only a short street car journey away from all the noise and action!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelustej
Reviews.Content: I stayed with girlfriends at the Maison for four nights back in December. The hotel room itself was admittedly standard and even slightly worn. But the location and price were ideal. You are right on the streetcar line and equidistance between the Garden District and the French Quarter. The price is very reasonable and the noise is nothing compared to what you would probably encounter staying in the French Quarter. There are some great restaurants in the immediate area. I found the outside of the hotel charming and thought the courtyard setup was very nice. No doubt, there are nicer places to stay in the city but for the above reasons I would definetly return to The Maison St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Helena Traveler
Reviews.Content: I guess you get what you pay for. This is a complex of buildings and we got a room in the 1970's motel. Outside entrances that look over a parking lot converted to a courtyard. The room was what you would expect a 'motel' room to be. Nothing special, but the price was good. The best part of the hotel was it's location. Located directly accross the street is a cable car stop which will take you to the French Quarter. Walking distance to the 'D-Day' Museum and RiverWalk.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb. 18-20th. All other hotels were much more expensive during that time so after reading positive reviews here I booked for $100 a night. All though the hotel is not in the "action" of the French Quarter I loved it. My boyfriend and I opted to walk to the French Quarter and did not feel unsafe even when walking Friday evening at 11 pm. The trolley is right by the hotel but I found the wait to be pretty long and was usually full by the time it got to the hotel. My only complaint was when we tried to go to the hotel bar around 10 pm on Saturday it was closed. We were going on a cruise Sunday and had the front desk hold our luggage so we could check out and then have breakfast at the attached restaurant, La Madelines (very good). Only had to wait a few minutes before a taxi showed up in front of the hotel to take us to the port. I would certainly recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Masion St. Charles from Feb. 23-25th. I had read a few of the revues that had been written here on tripadvisor before we booked the Hotel. We were looking for a nice place to stay, that was near everything we wanted to see, that wouldnt cost us a fortune. This Hotel met all of our expectations. We reserved a basic room, that cost us less than $100.00/night. The hotel is located in the Garden District, on the Streetcar line, and is just minutes away from the French Quarter. It is also surrounded by some pretty good restaurants. Emerils Del Monico is right across the street, Houstons restaurant, is right down the street, and theres a Le Madeleine right next door. So if you dont want to pay the exorbatant prices for food in the Quarter, you have other options. Our room at the Masion was small, but was very clean. The hotel itself is rather quaint, with a nice courtyard in the middle of the hotel, which is next to the Hotel Bar. The bartender at the Hotel Bar, Dianne, was GREAT ! She gave us some pointers on what we wanted to see while in New Orleans, and the best way to get their. She was also alot of fun and very friendly to us during our stay. Overall, the staff at the Hotel was extremely friendly, and were ready to help at our beckon call. The parking at the Hotel was very convenient, and our valuables always felt very safe. I would recoomend this Hotel to anyone of my friends in a minute. It is a nice, clean, easy accesible hotel, in a city full of OVER-priced hotels and meals. We will stay at the Maison St. Charles on our next trip back to the Big Easy. Tim

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1/16-1/18/05. Found the accomodations to be pretty much as described. We had a small room with queen bed. The room was simple, but clean. Staff were friendly and attentive. I thought the $14/day valet parking charge was kind of absurd, as we were told to go get our own car each morning when we asked for it. The price for parking wasn't bad however, when compared with other hotels. Seems you must pay to park in this city no matter where you stay. The location was great--you can jump on the streetcars right in front of the hotel and go anywhere. The neighborhood wasn't bad, and we felt pretty safe walking around there at night. Overall, it was a good experience, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We needed a reasonably priced hotel in the Garden District where my son was visiting Loyola U. Maison St. Charles was lovely. Some of the rooms are in renovated creole buildings - all rooms face courtyards. The staff was attentive, and polite. There's a casual French Bakery restaurant - La Madeleine - right next door - which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The only drawbacks: have to pay for valet parking and the rooms were quite small. Otherwise a great deal for the price. Can leave your car at the hotel and take the trolley which stops right in front. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Maison St. Charles Quality Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: KRLsmalltownOntario
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a 4 day New Year's Eve holiday and wedding. The staff at this older hotel were lovely, the accommodations were just as beautiful as the pictures. The location was fabulous, just a 10 minute trolley ride from the busy hustle of the French Quarter. We even walked it twice and it took less than 20 minutes, and felt safe walking even in the night. The rooms were spacious and clean, and had good service each day. The front desk clerk was friendly and helpful, they kept watch out for our missing luggage and kept it secure until we could pick it up. The hotel is right beside a french bakery/cafe and the staff there were super as well. I'd highly recommend this hotel, it was quiet and beautiful with 3 different courtyards to view from your rooms. Just a great holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, no complaints!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed here a few times on long weekends to New Orleans and we have had nothing but wonderful experiences at the Maison St. Charles. The staff is excellent and accomodating, and the pool and jacuzzi are available throughout the night (as long as your quiet!). I wouldn't have changed a thing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional !”
Reviews.Author: cyndshaw
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Everything about it was great from the price, the rooms and the staff. They couldn't have been nicer or more willing to assist. I won't stay anywhere else. Just for your info...never, never go to the Quality Inn - Mid city.

Reviews.Title: “'Disappointing' from Missouri got it right....”
Reviews.Author: Stujo4
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and booked Sat and Sun nights for an average of $99 each and thought I got a bargain until I checked in. They bought a city block and moved separate buildings on to it (all rooms have outside entrances, like a motel) and refurbished it all in 1984 and apparently not much has changed since. Peeling paint and just a general state of shabbiness abound. Our room was clean, but cracked bathroom tiles, cast iron headboards that bang on the wall when you sit on the bed, dim lighting (can't really see in the bathroom without the heat lamp on) and a lackadaisical staff made me decide that this wasn't a very good value. I think you can do better for the price in the Garden District and I know you can in the Central Business District. High point: Quick and courteous valet parking is only $14/day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lucky Random Pick...Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alibyrd
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Maison St. Charles & it was outstanding! Atmosphere reminded us of Paris &, while not lavish, the room was great...clean, comfortable, quiet...a good deal for the price! Streetcar took us anywhere we needed to go for $5/day...can't beat that! We intend to go back for our 20th anniversary in 2 yrs!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjtm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in New Orleans for a convention. We stayed in a 2 bathroom suite, with a living room and a bedroom. The hotel location was nice, it was out of the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter, but right on the St. Charles streetcar line, so it was fairly easy to get anywhere (walk to convention center took about 15 minutes). Our room was weird, very large, and a strange mix of new and antique furnishings. We were on the top floor of one of the buildings, so we kind of felt like we were in the attic. The pool of the hotel was nice, a little small but nice. Jacuzzi was also nice, but broke the last day we were there. Loved the pastry shop being right next door. Yum! All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Quality Inn & Suites St. Charles while in New Orleans for my graduation from Loyola University. I was nervous about this first trip to New Orleans, but I found the accomodations to be wonderful. The location was great, the 1900 block of St. Charles Street, next door to a Wendys and a Le Madeline Bakery, and within walking distance/Streetcar ride of several other restaurants. The streetcar stops right in front of the hotel, and the bank across the street from the hotel sells streetcar passes. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. I arrived before noon, and check-in was not til 3 PM, but the staff held my bags for the afternoon while I freshened up and went to explore the area. The room had a King sized bed, the A/C worked fine, there was cable TV, a swimming pool, and a cute courtyard right outside my room. Best of all, I could not hear the people in the rooms next door, so I was able to get some rest before going out on the town. I would gladly stay at this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: cfarina
Reviews.Content: The AAA book rated this hotel as a great value for the money. After spending a week here, I would have to agree. I also liked the fact that it wasn't in the French Quarter. It was nice to come back to a quiet area of town after being in the French Quarter. There was a good restaurant attached to the hotel Le Madeleine, and others within walking distance. The people at the hotel were pleasant and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites Maison St. Charles
HotelInfo.Address: 1319 St. Charles Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70130
